Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 4 Star Hotel near St Germain with Exc. Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Miles R
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at this hotel, the staff were all very helpful, happy to speak English. The hotel is in a terrific location, I caught the Metro from the Eurostar taking only 25 minutes - it's on Line 4 - get off at Vavin. We had breakfast included which made our day start in excellent fashion. The rooms are quite small, but very well made out with fridge, safe, plasma TV and bathtub / shower. There are larger suites available. Reception staff member Allan was very helpful, recommending restaurants and helped with printing boarding passes. Happy to recommend this hotel - check their website for specials, and if it is on the website "Mr and Mrs Smith", it is good enough for most travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: GatorGrad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel des Academies et des Arts and found it lovely. Its a small boutique hotel in an alleyway near restaurants, shops and several rail stations. An easy walk from the mainline coming from Charles de Gaulle airport. While the rooms are small, the furniture and appliances are all modern and well kept. The place is clean. The front desk was very helpful reserving tables at restaurants and with general information and directions. Would definitely recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Erin Y
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location and terrific staff. Could not be happier with my stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading website information”
Reviews.Author: DS512
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately this has been the one Hotel I've booked after reading Tripadvisor reviews, which I have been hugely disappointed with. As much as all Hotels put their 'best' imagery online and iron out any unsightly sections etc, I still wasn't prepared for how different this property looked in reality (to how it is portrayed on the website). It is sandwiched between a Best Western and some small shops down a side street, off a very busy road. It didnt look anything like the stylish imagery online. The whole property is very dark and the rooms, well as documented really - are beyond small. We booked one 'Club' and one 'Superior' room - and whereas the Superior was just about ok (if you didnt intend staying in it very much), the Club room was hideously claustrophobic. The walls have velvet sections on .. not so much for design as more so you do not bump yourself in the small space to get in and out of bed. The bathroom is so tight, I burnt my leg on the radiator every time I needed to use the loo!! When we were in our rooms, I had to open the room door, just to try and have some sense of space - not least because it was very dark inside and the small window overlooked a brick wall. We encountered a lot of noise from the flats next door (the one next to the Superior room ran water constantly .. what were they doing??!) and the flat beside my room had building work going on the whole weekend. I must also flag that there is a very sharp turn from outside the rooms to the top step of the flight of stairs - quite dangerous, especially for children. The Hotel does have a nice little tea-room, but when we were there it was full of non residents and we couldnt get a seat (it is a very small area). We weren't really given very much information about the facilities (such as we didnt even know the drinks in the Superior Room mini bar were complimentary!) and it was almost impossible to warm the Superior Room as we had the heating full on and it didnt seem to do anything! As much as anything, this Hotel is not on the Leftbank - please dont be under any impression that you are in the St Germain area of that side of the River . The property is actually in Montparnesse. It does have some interesting history regarding the artists whom used to live in and around the area - and a few cool art galleries and famous cafe-bars. The Montparnesse cemetry is about 5 mins from the Hotel, where Jean-Paul Satre and Simone de Beauvoir are buried (as are Samuel Beckett and Man Ray) and the Luxembourg Gardens and the Pantheon are close by to walk to. It will take about 25-30 mins to walk to the likes of the Notre Dame/ Leftbank 'proper' (downhill) and significantly longer returning .. as it is all uphill! This would have all been fine if we had actually prepared for being in that vicinity! For us, we were disappointed due to feeling somewhat misled as to where the property is and the 'estimated' walking distances to the sights. I have been to Paris a number of times but never stayed anywhere other than very Central - so to me, this Hotel was much further out than we were expecting - and that and the lack of light and any sense of space within the property, didn't make for a happy booking on this occasion. This all said, the Hotel is clean and the common areas are kept nicely. If you are fine with small rooms and noise from the neighbours (and the extra walking), I have no doubt this could be an acceptable base for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: GillBray
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the hotel and I still can't believe how easy it was to get there. From St Pancras via Eurostar to the Gare du Nord, onto the Metro and once you get to Vavin it's 2 mins to the hotel with small (well it s a major city!) but beautifully appointed rooms. The staff were very friendly, the breakfasts were perfect, the room was serviced daily and the sheets were changed too! We ate at the restaurant across the road, Wadja, that also provides the room service menu and the food was fantastic - satisfying even our exacting standards! The location is perfect with the Metro so close you can get everywhere you need to with minimal travel time. I can't understand why you would want to stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Rooms, I'd stay there again!!”
Reviews.Author: GiveBackToTrip
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful. HOTEL/STAFF The managers were great, namely Alan and Patricia. The night shift woman helped us as well. She wasn't approachable but after a few questions she seemed to warm up and got us the information we needed. All 3 spoke English very well so that was great. The male night manager wasn't as aware of things as the day staff. He wasn't very easy to talk to. I think the night duty knows less about hotel stuff in general. ROOMS We stayed in room #54, man ray room for the first few nights. Room was small. The toilet was in one side of the room and shower/sink on other side,which was fine by me. It was a bit tight to move around with 2 of us, but we made do. We moved into a superior room, #52 for the next few nights since we extended our stay there instead of moving to another hotel in marais. This would have been convenient to shopping areas etc, but moving seemed more of a hassle and we liked Alan and the service the very first day. So we made that change the first day we got to academies. This room was facing the courtyard so not mug noise. One night there was some music coming from somewhere but that's it. The maid cleaning the room next door with the vacuum was what woke us up. Room 52 was larger than man ray and costs about 40 euros more. I think it's worth it if you stay more than a few days. We were in the hotel for a week. It seemed a bit larger than standard rooms in the USA. The room was facing the street and we were a bit worried, but it was pretty quiet since it was the 5th floor. Minor appearances could be worked on in both rooms: - grout in bathroom - scuff marks in tub - small carpet stains Overall, great staff, modern rooms, clean rooms. Thanks to our friends that stayed there and found it on trip advisor!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: glenisb2000
Reviews.Content: Wonderul boutique hotel. The best part of this hotel is the location! We walked everywhere, Le Jardin Du Luxembourgh is very close, St. Germain, Montparnass, the Louvre are all within walking distance. The staff was great, always asked us if we needed any assistance of where to go, what to do and what to eat. The room was very clean, a little small but that is the norm in Europe. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a great location and service.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay if you're going to Paris”
Reviews.Author: JoelusDJ
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just spent a fantastic long weekend in Paris and we can't recommend this hotel enough! The service is first class, friendly and helpful. The hotel itself although small is perfectly formed and has a real feeling of luxury. The rooms are compact (as are most in Paris) but are designed brilliantly to give you everything you need and the beds are incredible - we could have slept for days had there not been so many things to explore in Paris! But possibly the best thing about this hotel is its location, 3 different Metro lines and an RER (for airport and eurostar connections) within a 5 minute walk enabling you to get anywhere in Paris quickly and easily, as well as being surrounded by restaurants and a stones throw from Les Jardin Du Luxemborg for some open space and beautiful nature. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Parisian Experience”
Reviews.Author: CookieBar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I met our friends from England in Paris for the weekend and had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The location is great in the Montparnasse area. It is close to the Luxembourg Gardens and a block away from the Metro. The staff were very friendly and helpful with recommendations for restaurants, shopping and open markets. The macarons and tea in the afternoon were a nice treat. The hotel was clean, quiet, uniquely decorated, and very pleasant to spend a long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “A boutique style hotel, small but modern and clean”
Reviews.Author: GinDandy
Reviews.Content: Trying to find a very nice hotel in Paris for 300 euros a night or less is not easy. We were happy with our choice to stay here as it is quite chic, but sans the grand lobby and amenities of a 5 star luxury hotel (fine by us as we were out most of the time). It's located south of St. Germaine de Pres but convenient to metro. The neighborhood is very residential with a lot of local traditional French bistros and restaurants, but no shopping. We rented bikes from one of the stands that are all over the city for less than 2 euro an hour and it was 10 min to Notre Dame. I do like other neighborhoods in Paris better to stay in but this was ok. Room was small of course. My husband is over 6 feet tall and basically between the 2 of us and luggage we had to take turns getting ready as moving about was cramped! Bed was comfortable though! Staff was helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location in Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveler280
Reviews.Content: The Montparnasse area avoids much of the crowded and touristy area of St. Germain yet from the hotel you can take a 20 minute walk to PSG. Front desk staff very helpful and cheerful. Answered all questions throughly. We had a double, superior room which was clean , well appointed though smaller than I had expected. Bathroom new, clean but again a tight fit. Stand up shower in the tub. This is not surprise to anyone visiting Paris where large rooms are the exception. There were many restaurants nearby, including the well known La Coupole. We ate breakfast at the many small restaurants or quick breakfast take out places. There are 2 Metro stops and a Hop On Hop Off bus stop within 5 minutes of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Bluefloatybubbles
Reviews.Content: Had the best stay at a hotel at this hotel, was wonderful. We were made to feel very welcome and comfortable by the staff and the room was so comfortable we didn't want to leave! Three metro stops are very close by, and is about a 10 minute walk to saint-germain. Would definitely go again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca P
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 day stay at this hotel and were delighted upon arrival with the friendly staff and cleanliness of the rooms. The hotel was perfectly located near the Luxembourg gardens just a short metro hop to all the Paris highlights. The hotel staff helped us book restaurants and gave us all the help and details for each of our days activities. Rooms were clean, air conditioned, comfortable and of a good size for it's central location.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: AmyS11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in June this year for part of our honeymoon. We stayed for 4 nights. After being treated to some honeymoon treats at the previous hotel in Bruge, we were slightly disappointed to not even be congratulated on our wedding when we arrived - let alone be offered a complimentary glass of wine etc. We had informed the hotel of the special reason we were staying in Paris on more than one ocassion, but they didn't even ackowledge it. So this was disappointing. If you go for your hoenymoon don't expect any little touches or gestures to make your stay extra special. Shame really as its quite a nice hotel. Most people will be staying here for a holiday I guess, rather than a honeymoon, so don't let that put you off. The hotel location is great - we had been to Paris before and stayed nearer the Eiffel Tower area, which was also great, but this time fancied a change. This hotel is right near the Luxumberg Gardens - they are beautiful to say the least. A MUST see. We didn't have the best weather unfortunately, but I imagine on a beautiful warm summers day you could take a lovely picnic here and soak in the atmosphere. Tube stops very close by to get you to anywhere in Paris on the Metro. The hotel is right in the hustle and bustle of the Saint Germaine area in Paris. There is no shortage of restaurants and fast food outlets, lots of bars and bistros around. Perfect for foodies. Personally I prefer to be little further away from the manic city atmosphere - but still able to access the busy areas if I like - if you prefer a more sedate holiday the Eiffel Tower area has much wider set streets and less traffic and people.This hotel really IS in the thick of it - but this might suit many people. Because it is in the busy area it can be quite noisy at night - we had a front facing room. There are no views as such - just looks out onto a Paris side street. It does get a bit nosey around 6am when the world comes alive again but the room does have aircon so you can close your windows if necessary. The room itself was lovely. Very clean which is always a major plus point for me when booking a hotel room. Adequet size for two people. We had a club room - any smaller and we might have been complaining there wasn't enough room. There is luckily a suitcase stand which helps leave floor space for manouvering. We had a bed, which was very comfy, side tables, mood lighting, two full length windows, a small dressing table with stool, and a full length mirror behind it, a little bistro style table with two chairs, and a teeny wardrobe. The wardrobe didn't impress much as it was so so small you could only fit about 5 things hung inside - and then the door wouldn't shut as the hangers provided were too wide for the wardrobe - very odd! Also the safe and the mini firdge were in one side of the wardrobe - which is fine - but the heat that the fridge created would melt anything inside the wardrobe - so don't store cosmetics in here! Probably a perk in the winter when you get your clothes out the wardrobe and they are all warm and toasty! The bathroom was SMALL! but fully functional. there is no door as such to the bathroom - rather a thick curtain that you pull across the room to separate the bathroom from the bedroom. So can be private if you wish. There is standing space for one person. A very shallow sink - quite difficult to wash in as so shallow you couldn't fill with much water. A mirror above the sink, and a bath/shower. This shower was fine - but nothing special. It worked and it was fairly powerful. Window in bathroom area a god send, as at least the steam from the shower can be ventilated outside. The toilet is in the bathroom but with a door to close - so in its own kind of cubicle. Breakfast was lovely - very french - but thats what you would expect in Paris! Can't remember the price but I think it was probably quite expensive for what you got - there are pastry shops just a hop skip and jump away to purchase your brekkie from - so don't feel you have to pay for breakfast. We did on this occassion as it was our honeymoon. It compramised of croissants (lovely!), breads, jams, butter, orange and grapefruit salad bowl, juice or tea or coffee and yogurt. Quite basic for the price. But very delicious. The area that you eat in is very dark! I know this is an art hotel as such but it felt a little clinical and try hard for my liking with its decor and dark ambience. Don't get me wrong - its a lovely hotel, but a bit dark and mysterious - perhaps a little pretentious. The herbal teas they do are beautiful tho - highly recommend a pot of herbal tea! Its not the friendliest hotel either - the greetings and checking out seemed quite clinical also - not many smiles from the receptionists or warmth - don't let this put you off though - your in Paris to see the sights not speak to the receptionist. Really great point it that they have a luggage storage cupboard where you can leave your stuff if you don't need to leave Paris too early. It seemed very secure as only the receptionist has a key. Also, a little tip - the toilets downstairs (below reception) are better than the room toilets - a bit more space and luxury. Overall an adequet hotel - I am not sure about all the rave reviews though - it IS lovely, but not THAT lovely. I would say pretty average as far as hotels go. Clean and modern though and very central to the buzz of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! I'd return in a heartbeat:”
Reviews.Author: Ed S
Reviews.Content: On arriving at your hotel, we were made incredibly welcome and comfortable staight away. I was even complemented on my French,which was most definitely a welcomed first. The room was fantastic, the facilities were great, the ambience was warm and beautifully decorated and most of all, every single member of hotel staff was polite, smiling, and eager to help in every way possible. We couldn't have had a nicer stay, thank you and we hope to see you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: SteveOsmond
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 4 day Paris break and loved the place. We found the location ideal, especially with Vavin metro station just around the corner. The hotel was clean, quiet and the staff friendly and helpful. We stayed in a club room and booked direct with the hotel to get their Early Bird offer. Room rates are quite high but then everything is pricey in Paris! Will definitely be going back in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Paris experience”
Reviews.Author: adahl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location with access to three different Metro lines in the lively Latin Quarter district. The recently renovated interior is beautiful, and the rooms are gorgeously decorated. I highly recommend breakfast, which has multiple courses of delicious pastry and fruit. The staff is incredibly nice and helpful, and made us a reservation at a local restaurant. Rooms are small, as one should expect for Paris, but was enough space for us. However, the tight bathroom required an agile body to navigate into and out of the shower.

Reviews.Title: “A great, comfortable base to explore the real Paris”
Reviews.Author: huses
Reviews.Content: This was our second stop in Paris on a recent visit to Europe, and we chose this hotel as the basis for a four day stay. This hotel also excelled in customer service, with the front desk staff all being very knowledgeable and helpful about the city and going out of their way to make our stay an easy one, always with a smile. We loved the breakfasts. The decor of the hotel is both intriguing and very comfortable and SO stylish. Whilst the rooms are compact, they use every space and were extremely comfortable. A great location close to Montparnasse and one senses an area where Parisians live and eat. Some great restaurants in the vicinity, a short walk to jog / walk around the Jardin du Luxembourg and Metro stations within a stones throw.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: TEldridge
Reviews.Content: The staff were all incredibly helpful and friendly (and they speak English if you don't know French or it's quite rusty, like mine.) My room was clean, comfortable and a good size for a European hotel. I loved being able to open the windows to let in the cool night air. The location is great--le Metro stop (Vavin)is across the street, so it was very easy to get there from la Gare du Nord. It's also mere minutes away from La Jardin du Luxembourg--beautiful, and within walking distance of La Notre Dame du Paris and Le Tour Eiffel! Oui, oui! The breakfast is delicious and more than enough for one person--well worth the $$! I loved staying here and will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice, fantastic front of house staff, small rooms (despite paying for upgrade)”
Reviews.Author: Lee_Harrington
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 nights in Hotel des Academies et des Arts. We had a lovely stay, made even lovelier by the brilliant personal service provided by the staff. We are used to staying in the Marais, so found this location to be quite different (less trendy, touristy, chic but very pleasant all the same). As with all Parisien hotels, the rooms were tiny. None the less we were somewhat disappointed given that we had paid extra for a "larger" room. The welcome gift of some Herme macaroons was very much appreciated. All in all a successful stay, not the Four Seasons, but a nice choice.

Reviews.Title: “Would absolutely recommend to friends!”
Reviews.Author: chezshai
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for a portion of our honeymoon and really enjoyed it. The decor was lovely and we talked with many of the front desk staff members and they were all quite courteous and helped us make reservations for dinner on several nights. They had wonderful recommendations for whatever it is that we were craving each night and even pulled up menus for us to look at on their computer, when needed. The room was well appointed, but fairly small. This was not unexpected, but it was our only negative comment about this hotel. We loved the location, which was not in the heart of tourism, but on a quiet street right across the street from the Vavin metro station (and near several other lines as well). The area was vivacious enough that we were able to find great restaurants and cute cafes, but it wasn't too noisy at night. We didn't try the breakfast or the cafe, but we would recommend that you try any of the other places on the block for something a little cheaper. Overall, we would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend, firstly for the great not-too-touristy location, and second for the lovely decor and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Bucks73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 9 nights for a combined business/leisure stay and loved it. The service was fantastic - very friendly and were very helpful in all aspects, including recommending great restaurants and cafes nearby. After the first 9 nights we left for Germany for a few days before returning to Paris for one final night before returning home. The hotel were gracious enough to leave some luggage behind while we went to Germany and then when we returned our luggage had been placed in our rooms. Very helpful. The rooms are relatively small, but I understand this is the norm in Paris. Despite this they were still very comfortable and the bathrooms were finished to a high standard. The beds, pillows and linen were very clean and comfortable, some of the best we've found in hotels. Housekeeping kept them clean and tidy everyday. We loved the location. 20 metres away is Vavin metro station which is on the line to St Michel and Notre Dame (about 8 minute ride) and from Vavin you can catch the metro to a another station to go the Eiffel Tower (again, only about 8 minutes ride), or just walk to the connecting station (about 5 minutes). If you haven't been to Paris, you should also know that the Metro is fantastic; you never have to wait more than about 4 minutes. The hotel it seemed was in quite a classy, well-to-do area. We felt safe walking around the area at all hours. Luxemburg gardens is only about 5 minutes walk away. You can also walk to Montparnasse viewing platform for views all over the city. There are plenty of great cafes and restaurants around the hotel with friendly staff. Not being to Paris before, this was a delight as sometimes the generalisations of French people can be less than kind in terms of friendliness. We didn't find this at all, with everyone we came in contact with more than obliging and most speaking English quite well. We really enjoyed our stay in the area and at Hotel des Academies et des Arts, particularly for the service, the friendly staff, the comfort and the location. We'll definitely stay there again if we go back to Paris...hopefully very soon. I had colleagues staying close to the Eiffel Tower and they were jealous. They paid more for poorer quality accomodation. If you stay closer to the landmarks I'm sure you pay a premium, not just for accomodation, but also for incidentals such as coffees, water, drinks, pastries. We noticed prices were at least half for these items around Montparnasse. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice but room is far too tiny for the price and location.”
Reviews.Author: bon800
Reviews.Content: The hotel is done up nicely and is well run but the rooms are far too small for comfort. The room size would have been justifiable at a lower price or if the hotel was in a dead central location but at overâ‚¬220 per night the price per square metre did not provide value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and comfort”
Reviews.Author: KarenOz_11
Reviews.Content: A complete package for those that like convenience and comfort We were originally concerned that we were staying a week in one hotel and that it may have some limitations over this extended period. This concern quickly evaporated once we arrived and experienced the exceptional service and quality offering of this hotel. The proximity to local shops, park, metro and restaurants made the location ideal and allowed us to experience a true flavour of Parisian life. Hotel des Academies et des arts was a stand out hotel in our European travels and has left us with fond memories and appreciation of the effort made to us while we were there. We have had no hesitation in recommending this hotel to our friends as well as staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff! Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Fanny6464
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel in April 2011 and could not be more happy with our choice! Great staff, always wanting to help and recommend places (we loved le Timbre or la Rotonde). Easy to walk anywhere or take one of the metro stations around. 2 minutes walk from the gorgeous Luxembourg garden. We would recommend this boutique hotel to anyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Gjt2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for first time in April in a superior room. From arrival to departure staff were excellent. We had breakfast every morning which was great. If staying again we would request the same or similar room. The room overlooked the street at the front of the hotel. We did look at a room at the back of the hotel which was smaller and overlooked an internal courtyard, which would be a bit small for more than a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good find”
Reviews.Author: msbeatrice
Reviews.Content: I came to know of this hotel through Mr and Mrs Smith website. I then read reviews on Tripadvisor and found out it was ranked 36 in Paris. When I went back to read about it again a few days just before my trip, its ranking had dropped to no. 54. I wondered why and it was not until my stay at the hotel did I find out it's drop in ranking. First, the good things: 1. Location. This hotel has a great location. Not that it is near the shopping malls like Galleries and Printemps, but it has many bakeries, cafes and restaurants just a few mins walk away. We ate at La Rotonde (excellent french food), La Pizzerata (great pizzas), Tavola Di Gio (fantastic Southern Italian fare), just to name a few. There are a couple of groceries to choose from and also a laundromat nearby. very convenient. There was no trouble getting to the hotel from the airport either. Take the RER and drop at Port Royal and the best part is, this station has an elevator. there is no need to lug your luggage up and down the stairs like the metro stations all around Paris. Then the walk to the hotel from Port Royal is about 10 mins. easy peasy. 2. Service. My husband and I are extremely satisfied with the service which the hotel provides. Henry, especially was exceptionally friendly. The staff spoke good English and everyone was most helpful. 3. Free Wifi. You get a printed slip for the code and password and wah-lah, you get free internet at the lobby and anytime you step into your room. The not-so-good things: 1. Small room. I stayed in the Classic room. I was prepared for a small room but the room was ridiculously small. So small that my husband and I each had to take turns to walk across the room. There was no space for us to open our luggage properly. There was a stand provided but if you use it, it blocks out the window and you can't open it. Perhaps the other rooms are bigger. Not sure. 2. Weird toilet. The toilets and the shower are not together. so which means you get out of the toilet, go over to the bathroom and wash your hands. The bathroom was small too and there was no bars or hooks to hang one's clothes. I had to use to little stool at the desk in the room to place my clothes. Also, there are 3 knobs in the shower. it took us a while to figure out how to get the shower going. Wished the hand held shower was placed much higher. The doors of the shower didn't keep the water in either. Hence, the floors were wet at times. 3. Soft pillows. I asked for firmer ones but they didn't have any. One of the reviews mentioned 'springy' pillows. it's true. it was a little hard to get a good night's sleep. 4. House-keeping. I did tell the hotel that house-keeping is a little slip-shot. For example, the empty tissue box was not replaced with a new one, new toilet rolls were not placed in the toilet when the last roll was used, bathroom floor was not thoroughly mopped and dirty plates were not cleared in the evening. there was no turn-down service but I guess I can't expect that from a small, boutique hotel. But overall, if you aren't picky and love to stay in a reasonably priced boutique hotel, give this a try.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect find in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: cmsljoint
Reviews.Content: This hotel in the Luxembourg quarter of Paris, is a great value gem. High standard of decor, maintenance and style make it a perfect base for enjoying Paris without breaking the bank. Whilst the rooms are small, they have all you need, and the beds are very comfy (ours was queen size). If you like breakfast, make sure you have theirs, as you get fresh-squeezed juice & fruit salad, excellent quality yogurt, more fresh bread and pastries than one should really consume, plus good quality tea, coffee or chocolate - all for 15 euro per person. The staff are lovely, helpful and multi-lingual, and the extra touches like the fresh flowers through the hotel and complimentary macarons and bottled water on arrival made us feel very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Really really good service and fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: blueandru
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had only every lived in Paris as penny-pinching students, so we never took the time to appreciate the simple beauty of the Left Bank. I'm so glad we finally did it. We stayed in Paris for 5 nights and this hotel was in the perfect location for us to walk to Notre Dame, Jardins de Luxembourg, eat fantastic food (especially at Le Timbre) and wait for our seriously rusty French to come back to life. My only small complaint is that we had the biggest room and it still wasn't particularly roomy. That said, the room really is only for sleeping! By the way, the staff are absolutely fantastic! Great hotel. Really really good service and fantastic location. M

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good location, tight rooms”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaBroadwayFan
Reviews.Content: I've recommended this hotel to several people traveling to Paris. Although small, it's a great place to stay. We choose this hotel based on reviews from other travelers, so we got pretty much what we expected. The staff is wonderful! They speak excellent English and didn't mind doing so. They pointed out local places of interest, provided maps and directions, and explained the Metro system. It should be noted that the front desk keeps your room key when you leave the hotel and that key is needed to active the lights in the room. The rooms are small. Boutique is apparently a French word that means microscopic. Thankfully, we were able to store our bags downstairs. The main complaint is the bathroom. We stayed on the top floor, rear of the hotel (I think there are only four rooms per floor) so it was quiet, but the bathroom overlooked a court-yard of sorts. The bath/shower is small with only a half partition, so water gets everywhere. The toilet is in a separate closet-sized room. Tip: if you make a reservation, ask for a room facing the street; it has a full-size shower. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in and took up about 75% of the room. The television was horrible and didn't work half the time. There's only two English stations (CNN and BBC News). Breakfast is an issue in France. It seems most Parisians think of breakfast as a croissant, a cup of extremely strong coffee, and a cigarette. The hotel had an elegant, over-priced continental breakfast. There isn't a pancake to be found in that part of Paris. We found a rather decent cafe about two blocks from the hotel with a full service restaurant across the street the serves something that passes for breakfast. There are tons of restaurants around the hotel for lunch and dinner. People eat late there. It wasn't unusual to see a packed restaurant at 10 pm with people still coming in. Waiters won't rush you to eat and you almost have to tackle them to get the check. A meal can easily take 2 or 3 hours. Smoking is only allowed on the patios, so be aware that eating outside usually means a heavy dose of nicotine. For those who enjoy public transit, the hotel is perfectly located. There are a few stations serving several of the more popular transit lines within a five minute walk from the front door. Save a long and expensive taxi ride by taking the RER B line directly from CDG airport to the Port Royal station, a ten minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jamlicious87
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights here for valentines Sunday and Monday, driving from Scotland. Having champagne on arrival through to departure on Tuesday midday my stay was faultless. My only criticism would be that it is down a small rugged back street (ended up paying $60 parking) and the room I was in was pretty small. That's not a complaint though, just an observation. Although we had breakfast both mornings I don't think the hotel had a restaurant for dinner but it is yards away from one or two good quality restaurants. I'll no doubt be returning to Paris at some point, and I'd happily stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but unahppy and incompetent staff”
Reviews.Author: BSaxe
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a prime location, but the staff leave a lot to be desired. When we arrived, we were handed a key with no other niceties. Although it was never mentioned when we checked in or at breakfast, if you book on Expedia, breakfast is not included and it's 12 euros per person - we were ambushed at checkout with a bill for 96 euros. We also asked the man at the desk to book us at taxi for 12pm four hours ahead of time, and at 12:30pm we were frantic as he had forgotten to call and could not find a taxi anywhere in Paris. Instead of trying to help with other options, he threw up his arms and left us to figure it out for ourselves. About 1pm, he mentioned the metro station nearby. We would have missed our train if it had not been for it being delayed. So, despite the location, we will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: Robsmodern
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here last spring for a weekend. We had high hopes for this hotel, as it was ranked (at the time) in the top 15 hotels in Paris. Sadly, it didn't live up to expectations. Rooms were small (even by Paris standards - rooms at the Ibis are larger, and for one-third of the price!) and rather disappointingly furnished. I saw no evidence of the supposed art, with the exception of the mural in the elevator shaft, as noted by a previous reviewer. The location was unremarkable. For the price that you're paying, you expect a boutique experience. Worst was the service: management was nice enough, but the staff were disagreeable. After we reported a problem, we were laughed at by the (admittedly junior) clerk on duty ... we had to wait for her manager to take care of it the next day. To give the hotel some credit, the bed was fine, the place seemed to be kept in reasonable shape, and the neighbourhood was safe. Unfortunately, this hotel simply doesn't live up to its reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and friendly”
Reviews.Author: trelew1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in March and enjoyed it a lot. Very friendly staff. Paris hotel rooms are nether cheap nor large and this is no exception. The rooms however are comfortable, decently kitted out (great showers) and offer decent value. Enjoyed meals round the corner at La Rotonde. One minor quibble - we both thought the pillows were too springy!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute gem”
Reviews.Author: TheMajor22
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews and found the excellent rating to be fully deserved. As other have said: - Service: impeccable; - Great magic touches - Pierre Hermes Macarons on arrival were a great intro to Paris; - Rooms - modern, very comfortable, cool; - Location - brilliant - secluded and away from the 'tourist trap', but close enough to walk to the sites, or hop on the various metro stops close by; Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every way”
Reviews.Author: Chloe1200
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this charming, small hotel last November, and we loved it! The service was outstanding in every way, and the staff were all friendly and knowledgable about restaurants, directions and traveling connections, particularly Patricia and Henry, who made us feel very welcome immediately and were not offended by my horrible attempt at speaking a little French. Yes, the rooms are small, but we did not have a problem with that. It was impeccably clean, and the bed, very comfortable. We stayed in a middle-sized room with a view of the street. We went to sleep each night and woke each day with the scent of the aromatherapy created especially for this hotel. The location is especially convenient. We easily took the RER and walked about a block when we first arrived. After that, we walked to wonderful Montparnasse restaurants (the hotel staff made reservations for us before arrived), and easily caught the Metro at Vavin to everywhere else we wanted to go. We highly recommend the hotel breakfasts, especiallly the yogurt from a farm in Normandy, the local pastries, fruit and wonderful coffee. I want to go back! Be sure and have dinner at Le Timbre bistro if you stay here. It was the best!

Reviews.Title: “staff very helpful, friendly; clean rooms; great bed”
Reviews.Author: erinmargo
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the new year holiday. Easy access to nice restaurants, interesting sites and to many metro stations & walking from the hotel. Staff more than willing to help us get everywhere we wanted to go and asked us about our day/trip. Bed was awesome--needed that at the end of the day. Quiet -- little street noise. Great deep bathtub to soak in at days end. Rooms are small, but not unusual for a boutique hotel in Paris. No view -- except the painting on the wall that faced our window. Well decorated, nice amenities, nice touches with heart shaped sugar cubes, color scheme & artistes theme... Caution that the breakfast is 16 Euro per for a relatively light breakfast -- may be more worthwhile to go out than to eat at the hotel. I will stay here again when I return and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ambience, good location and welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: bizwarrior
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a Christmas holiday in Paris. We booked this hotel as I had lived in the neighborhood as a student, many years ago. Very easy trip on the train from CDG to Port Royal and a nice welcome from Patricia. The candles, colors and low lighting create an inviting atmosphere. We were warmly greeted and taken to our room after our long trip. We were given a choice, a nice touch and selected Man Ray. Nice color scheme and small, even for Paris standards. There were some misses and we felt that the staff was helpful but not a lot of information given like--room service, etc. The location made travel throughout the city easy and we liked walking on the Notre Dames des Champs and the smaller streets nearby. Montparnasse has changed a great deal and it seemed less "gay" and fun than I had remembered it. We didn't take breakfast or any of the services for food as we were always out doing things. The staff makes every effort to help and inquire about your plans. Many suggestions turned out to be incorrect. Please don't eat at Le Select or La Coupole, both are abysmal and expensive. The hotel did offer wifi and we had a devil of a time setting it up but it did work eventually. We liked the patisserie on Notre Dame des Champs and the restaurant Charivari nearby. We suggest you see the Musee Marmottan (16th), Fondation Pierre Berge & Yves Saint Lauren as well as the Bacarat museum. We took in the ballet at the Bastille as well as the opera, both well worth it. Paris has changed a lot and this hotel was a warm spot during a chilly but fun week.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service in a delightful boutique hotel â€“ highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: ICokic
Reviews.Content: This was my first solo trip to Paris and I was extremely nervous, but staying in this beautiful hotel made it all that much more welcoming. From the minute I arrived up until the end of my stay the staff was fantastic. They were extremely helpful, very polite and immaculately well presented. The reception is 24 hours, which permits inquire at any point in time. The hotel itself is located in one of the best areas of Paris (in my opinion). Although I went at a busy tourist time in this area I did not feel overcrowded at all. The hotel is also surrounded by various shops (e.g., bakeries, florists, restaurants, major shopping mall and fruit stores) and just a short stroll to the Luxenbourg gardens. My room was cleaned every day - spotlessly. Oh and the fancy shower was an experience :) I highly recommended staying here, I know I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience from arrival to farewell.”
Reviews.Author: TulsaMimi
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the advise of a travel company and tripadvisor's recommendations. We booked the superior room with the included breakfast. Our room was very comfortable and the breakfast got our days off to a good start. The location was a little further out than we expected, but, the metro was so convenient that we did not have any problems getting around. The weather was not really great for walking great distances so the metro was appreciated. This is our second trip to Paris and we enjoyed getting familiar with a different part of Paris. The staff was extremely helpful with our agenda, restaurants, and transportation to the airport. When returning to Paris, we will certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: XxVanillaxX
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely beatiful, chic fresh and clean. The staff was very sweet and helpful and all of them spoke perfect english. The room we stayed in was really nice in soft beige/brown tones, nice bathroom with a tub and a seperate toilet. The service at the hotel was great and when we arrived tha first day we were served beatiful macarones in our room. The matress in the bed was a bit hard but that may be the french way. We would recommend this hotel and we would absolutely stay here again. The location is perfect close to Parc Luxembourg and many nice restaurants in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Minimal Room, Minimal Service, But NOT Minimal Prices”
Reviews.Author: GiftBizGuy
Reviews.Content: If you read the reviews you will see consistent comments about the size of the room. At the risk of piling on...my 'classic" room was too small for this solo traveler; I can't imagine how a couple could manage it. No room for my bag, no room to put my laptop, no room for bath amenities, no room. I've managed OK in small rooms before - most notably at the Royalton, Paramount, and Hudson in New York - but this one really didn't work for me. Furthermore, the young American woman who greeted me at the desk was quite friendly but didn't really seem to know much, and later in my stay I waited and waited and waited while another desk person dealt with other guests and phone calls. Yes, the hotel design is quite chic and stylish...but in this case I don't find that sufficient. One tip if you decide to stay here -- be sure to book a meal at Le Timbre just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Much more than a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: gilmore35
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel was easily accessed via metro or RER line. Unfortunately we arrived on a day of strikes and protests and were exhausted by the time we made it to the hotel. Twhe staff were extremely welcoming, helpful and provided great recommendations during our stay. We were able to walk to all the major sites although we wewre definitely tired by the end of the day. The room was small as per all Parisian hotels but the fit out was stunning, the shower had massage jets and the towels were fluffy. The wifi access was exceptional. The sound proof windows made the rooms extremely quiet and comfortable. I will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and inviting”
Reviews.Author: Ruby_2893
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights late September. Rooms were very small but that was expected it is Paris after all. However, rooms were very nice and the bed was comfortable had some great sleeps. Staff were lovely and very helpful. We really liked the location Saint Germain is much more to our liking and this hotel is close to metro and some very nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: NYEscapees
Reviews.Content: Superb central location yet on a quiet street, close to 3 different Metro lines, many great restaurants and shopping. Our room was very clean, comfortable and modern. While rooms are small, (expected), comforts were many. Staff most helpful with dinner reservations, directions, suggested places to visit, and local orientation. Prepared us to navigate transportation strike. We can't say enough good things about the entire staff. Our future visits to Paris will include staying at Hotel des Academies et des Arts!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection - Exactly what we were looking for.”
Reviews.Author: Furintheworks
Reviews.Content: Wonderful small hotel perfectly located in a pleasant, safe neighborhood close to several metro lines as well as the RER. Well maintained, our room was clean and the bed was one of the most comfortable we've ever had and weâ€™ve travelled quite a bit. The room was well insulated from street noise, the bathroom was spacious and the shower was fantastic! Very welcome after a long day of standing and walking. The staff is extremely professional; competent while also very personable. Henri greeted us with pleasant enthusiasm, clearly knowing who we were, expecting us based only on information weâ€™d provided by email a couple of months prior. They gladly secured our luggage until our room became available. When we returned to check in, our luggage had already been taken to our room. Not wholly unexpected at a hotel of this caliber, weâ€™ve stayed at more expensive, large chain hotels where that wouldnâ€™t have been a given. Whether early morning (having worked the night shift) or after a long day, every other staff member we encountered was equally pleasant. Amazingly patient and tolerant of my clumsy, grotesque attempts at French, we were saved by all of the staffâ€™s comfort in speaking surprisingly fluent English. Genuinely interested in ensuring our stay in their hotel was enjoyable, they were equally eager to offer tips, suggestions, or information to help us get the most from our time in Paris without being the least bit intrusive. In spite of an unfortunate experience with a metro pickpocket, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and had a fantastic time in Paris. With so much more still to see, we will go definitely go back and wouldnâ€™t consider staying elsewhere. Hotel des Academies et des Arts is exactly as it appears on its website- what a website canâ€™t convey is the attitude and quality of the hotelâ€™s people, which exceeded all expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, boutique hotel with quiet and splendid location.”
Reviews.Author: chmod
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed like long time friends, and that goes a long way with us. After a brutal ride through Paris traffic from CDG, we immediately felt relaxed and welcomed. The personnel are stellar, the room was cozy, cool and quiet. We were able to walk to everything we wished to see this trip, without issue. Unfortunately, we only had one night but it was perfect for our desires., We will return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “We will return”
Reviews.Author: danny_bowles
Reviews.Content: Overall we could not recommend the hotel highly enough and what makes it great is the people who work there. You are made to feel welcome and guided to eat in the places parisians eat. Fabulous place to stay. As this is meant to be a useful resource I would mention a couple of things: Yes the rooms are small but we loved them. Do not spend â‚¬16 euros on breakfast in the hotel when for less than â‚¬5 you can go to the Boulangere opposite the cafe Vavin two minutes away and have a lovely simple breakfast or the Cafe Vavin and spend 8 or 9 euros for the full continental breakfast whilst soaking up the Parisian atmosphere. The proximity to the Jardin de Luxembourg is a great plus. The exchange rate hammered us and it does work out expensive if you are from UK but the location is just so perfect. Do take their recommendations on where to eat...there are four or five places less than 5 minutes walk which are all superb. Can't wait to go back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “93/100... This Hotel is all about service, Patricia & her Crew 95/100”
Reviews.Author: Henson_8
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed in this hotel for 4 night. Room size is what we payed for. Hotel is Clean, Great location 2 min walk to Vavin station, 5 min to Raspali. Patricia & her Staff gave perfect direction, very clear never miss a turn going around Paris. Hotel needs to improve in 2 aspect, Breakfast Quality with more choices, bed was too soft hard to sleep... will certainly come back... Oh did i mention that our room had a Tub... perfect after a long day walk in Paris......

Reviews.Title: “great place, i miss it”
Reviews.Author: iggyp70
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 6 days and loved it. a great base for discovering Paris, handy to the metro and close to great nightlife. Cosy rooms with great staff, the breakfasts were wonderfull. Fantastic value - we will go back.

Reviews.Title: “No heart...”
Reviews.Author: cjtnnyc
Reviews.Content: I planned a weekend in Paris for my fiance's birthday and booked 3 nights at this hotel. Three nights before our departure my fiance's very close friend died suddenly - we were devastated. We immediately contacted the hotel to explain our situation and ask to reschedule our visit so that we may attend the funeral. Despite guaranteeing a future stay at the hotel's convenience (and as soon as possible), they would not waive the cancellation fee or grant us any leniency. While I understand and appreciate their cancellation policy, I find it unfathomable that an exception cannot be made for extenuating circumstances, making a difficult situation even worse. I could never and will never give business to such an unfriendly establishment.

Reviews.Title: “J'Adore”
Reviews.Author: TribecaChica
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms were small, but they're perfectly decorated, and aren't all city hotel rooms small? It wasn't like we were tripping over suitcases. And the bathroom still had a full tub. The rooms were fresh and clean, and the mattresses and pillows fabulously. The staff was nice and incredibly helpful in finding places in the neighborhood and navigating places further off. And the hotel also seemed to attract the nicest travelers, who you'd see every morning in the small dining area. The neighborhood was cute, with a couple good cafes nearby. The Luxembourg Garden five minutes away, and everything else we wanted to do was a reasonable walk (the Orsay, the Rubin Museum) or a super-convenient metro ride away (the Louvre, Marais shopping). Overall, I can't say enough about how much of a perfect fit this hotel was.

Reviews.Title: “All in all we couldn't have been more pleased.”
Reviews.Author: KRK46
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Paris for the first time in August. We heard bad things about seeing the city during August but we did not experience issues. In fact, I would travel there in August again. Once you get over the fact Paris hotel room are very small get ready to love the Academies et des Arts. It's location is superb for walking to most everything. What's not walkable is within an easy metro ride. The hotel staff was very kind and helpful and we found the hotel itself to be absolutely charming. If we go back to Paris, and I would love to think of a reason why he must, we would love to stay at the Academeies et des Arts once again. Enjoy...but be prepared for small rooms. Think "cozy,"

Reviews.Title: “Ambivalent”
Reviews.Author: Zekebrenner
Reviews.Content: On the one hand, the place itself is nice. The rooms are tiny. On the whole, interesting & pleasant . But, it's in a really quiet neighbourhood. I prefer to stay relatively close to a selection funky eateries and shops (passed one at Cluny). What ultimately rescued this choice for me was its proximity to "Amorino", which had, perhaps, one of the finest ice creams I've ever had. Each night, before retiring, my family enjoyed some. I also thought the Italian young desk clerk(ette) was charming. I think that when I go back, I'll try to find something closer to Cluny, or to Le Grand Epicerie de Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Style over Space”
Reviews.Author: Punter_8
Reviews.Content: This is a fundamentally "pokey" hotel, not a bad hotel necessarily, but compact. Great effort has been made to gloss over its cramped nature with a distinctive boudoir style of decor, putting the emphasis on its boutique-ness thereby maximising the euro per square metre ratio, But in my opinion, beneath the unconvincing decor lies the fact that you don't get much for your money. Unfortunately some inappropriate design choices had left a curtain hanging perilously close to the toilet bowl in our ensuite, this looked like it may hve been mistaken at some point for toilet paper, we nicknamed it "the poo curtain". On the plus side the bed we had was comfortable and our room was quiet. On the service side of things we were offered a very warm welcome on arrival by a friendly young chap full of tips and reccomendations. Unfortunately the service was let down by a shambolic checkout performed by a middle aged lady. Unable to take payments from any of our cards, apparently our fault for having the audacity to carry UK cards, we were expected to march off to the ATM to source cash, without apology or thanks. We'd stay here again out of necessity rather than choice.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: PanWorld
Reviews.Content: If only all hotels could be like Hotel des Academies! A small boutique Hotel with only 20 rooms. All the staff, and particularly Henry, were extremely helpful, and always with a very positive attitude. We had a superior room which was large by Paris standards, but still not gigantic. Very comfortable and well appointed. Very quiet spot. Rooms have excellent and quiet aircond. Well located near a number of Metro stations and a very short walk to the beautiful Luxumbourg gardens. Without a doubt we would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted from a first trip”
Reviews.Author: 4091glittergal
Reviews.Content: As so many others have done, we booked this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. We got the metro from Gare du Nord to Vavin, which is a couple of minutes' walk from the hotel. The hotel itself is lovely - luxurious without being pretentious and the air con was welcome in the heat we experienced! All of the staff were very welcoming, and we were offered iced tea as we checked in. The gentleman at the desk gave us a map of Paris and marked everything on there we wanted to see, as well as some personal recommendations once he'd heard it was our first trip to Paris. Once we'd settled in the room we were presented with a plate of macaroons, which unfortunately I couldn't eat but my partner said were delicious! The room itself was not spacious, but there was more than enough room for everything and we had a walk in wardrobe, curtained off from the rest of the room. The bath was much appreciated as well and everything was well appointed. I had two niggles - one of the bedside lamps worked intermittently and the shower screen was a bit leaky, but they weren't a problem at all. On check out I mentioned it and am confident they'll be looked at. In terms of location, we could have spent an extra day walking around the Latin Quarter - Jardin du Luxembourg is at the end of the road and is very beautiful, and there's a myriad of cafes to visit for breakfast. We did not eat at the hotel as we thought it was slightly pricey and we had early starts on all three mornings, but there are plenty of other places to eat nearby. There are three or four metro stations within easy walking distance - Vavin, Raspaille and Montparnasse Bienvenue are all ones we used without difficulty. I'd recommend the hotel again, and am hoping to visit Paris with my mother, who would love the Impressionists exhibition in the Musee D'Orsay. Thanks to the Hotel Des Academies et Des Arts - see you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are small but perfectly formed and the staff friendly.”
Reviews.Author: DrPwk
Reviews.Content: Travelled August 2010 for 2 nights. We stayed in one of the largest rooms but this was still very small, however being from London I didn't mind this too much. There is plenty of storage space for all your things. The welcome was friendly but I feel the receptionist was a little overworked, she was very tired and as she was the only person there she couldn't leave the desk (not that we needed her too). We got a free map and she showed us where all the sights were which was very nice. Breakfast is continental only with no choice - 2 mini pastries, bread, 2 types of jam, butter, fresh orange juice, a yoghurt and freshly sliced oranges, plus a choice of tea/coffee/hot chocolate. This was more than enough food but it's always nice to have a bit of choice and I think my partner could have eaten a lot more! The price was a little steep too, however everything seemed to be closed given it was August so not sure where we would have gone for breakfast locally. The area is fine for getting to the sights, and well connected on the RER for Gare du Nord. I was disappointed with the lack of open shops etc. Nearly everything seemed to be closed due to Parisians being on holiday. It meant that it lacked atmosphere and just made it a bit of a let down as we were expecting lots of patisseries and things to be open! It's a Paris wide issue though so not much can be done about that. Overall I would recommend if you are happy to have a small room and to take public transport, it is a bit of a long walk to visit many of the sites so its getting a Paris Visitor card (very reasonable) or more expensive Taxi's (there were not too many about).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing nights sleep in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: trebmallien
Reviews.Content: From when we turned up to a friendly lady behind reception, to the well appointed room, comfy beds, nice rain showers, little balcony and the incredible peace and quiet. We loved the place. Yeah rooms are a little small, but that is Paris. Couldn't recommend it more.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - great service - tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: kfacpa
Reviews.Content: Ha ha.. ok rooms are tiny, but it's Paris... great location, close to Metro, mile from La Sein, mile and half from Eiffel Tower... Service is excellent, concierge very helpful. Room rate reasonable for what you get... Close to cafes/brasseries. Would come back again...

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and underwhelming.”
Reviews.Author: NG_2007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights in July at this hotel. I had booked it solely based on the overwhelmingly positive trip advisor reviews - the #2 hotel in Paris (!) and without doing any further research. After staying there I have to disagree with the high ranking and the high price. This is my 4th trip to Paris in 6 years and I have stayed at several hotels in several different districts in the past. First the location. Its located on a completely unremarkable little street about 6 blocks from a side entrance to luxembourg gardens (not the main entrance) - which puts it at a 30-40 minute walk from the main parts of the latin quarter (say rue mouffetard, boulevard saint michel or the pantheon). Other than the gardens, there is no other landmark or nice square or area worth visiting near this hotel. Second, the view from the hotel is the building opposite - which is most definitely not a charming building. And the street is not a charming street, or remarkable in any way. The hotel itself is completely ordinary. The entrance to the hotel is an ordinary door, like an apartment entrance, so you are taken aback right away. The "lobby" if you can even call it that is the size of a sitting room, with two small sofas and a desk where the receptionist sits. Its tiny, plain, and completely underwhelming. Third, the room. We booked a 16m sq room (one size up from the basic). I guess it must have been that big, but it did not feel like it. There was just enough room for one suitcase. I really can't imagine what the 13 m sq room is like. The furnishings were clean - a bit too brown and dark for my taste, but nothing to complain about. The view as I mentioned- was the plain building right across the narrow little charmless street. The bathroom was another issue, it was so tiny that one could not reach in to turn the water in the bathtub/shower on before you got in (Personally, I prefer to check that the water is not scalding hot or freezing cold before it comes down on my head :)). But the bathtub was deep and nice. Fourth, the art - which i only mention because it is mentioned many times on the hotel's website and seems to be a major selling point. There is a silhouette of a robot type of figure on the walls. And that's it. A white silhouette drawn on a wall in the lobby, in the elevator, and on one wall of the hotel room. There is no fitness room, or business facilities of any kind and the wifi was hopelessly slow. But the staff are friendly and seem quite helpful. Lastly, the hotel was so inconveniently located that we could not pop back in the middle of the day anyway for a rest. SO the good thing is that we got to be outside a lot! This is an unremarkable little hotel that should rank somewhere in the middle of the 2000 or so hotels ranked here. We paid $240 per night for a hotel that should not have been more than $100-120. There is a Best Western hotel next door that is comparable and was less than half the price we paid. On a side note, we had to come back for one night again after stopping in barcelona for 3 days - and we stayed at Hotel Des Grande Hommes - a view of the pantheon right outside the giant windows with flower boxes, a huge room, beautifully decorated, fantastic location - lower price!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - lives up to high expectations”
Reviews.Author: ResearchGirl
Reviews.Content: After reading the highly favourable reviews about this hotel on TripAdvisor, our expectations were high. And they were more than met on our stay of two nights. Fantastic service - all the staff were friendly and helpful and really made our stay a pleasure. Rooms are stylish and comfortable and atlhough air con works really well, it was even nicer to be able to open windows and have the fresh air. The area is delightful - a place where real people live and so close to the Jardin du Luxembourg. A delight to stay there and we are looking forward to going back to Paris, just so we can stay at Hotel des Academies et des Arts again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: thesuperfoodchef
Reviews.Content: ..nice quiet side street in a good area near the Jardin du Luxembourg comfortable beds welcoming staff- very hospitable lovely breakfast in their charming cafe area spacious for the city standards

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel from which to explore Paris!”
Reviews.Author: fdolan1
Reviews.Content: First, the hotel is clean, fashionable and in a great location---less than 100m to the #4 subway, from which you can get anywhere in Paris! The Luxembourg Gardens are a short walk, and they are beautiful! The staff is super! Their recommendations were 'spot on' for dinner, and morning coffee. The rooms are small....but this is Paris!!! We stayed for six nites and had a wonderful time! I'd recommend it and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A charming and stylish hotel with lots of Parisian ambience”
Reviews.Author: TravelSiMa
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel in July 2010. We have been to Paris many times before, but chose this hotel because of its excellent reviews on Tripadvisor -and we absolutely loved it. Location: The hotel is located in the 6. arrondissement in a side street of Boulevard Montparnasse. It took us 25 min by metro (take the exit â€œVavinâ€�, from here it is 2 min walking to the hotel) from Gare de Lâ€™Est to the hotel. If you like to walk, it takes about 15 min to the Ile de la cite and about 25-30 min to Marais. The metro line 12 brings you within 20 min to Montmartre. The location of the hotel is really nice; you can find several typical Paris cafes and restaurant around. Just opposite the hotel is the (old) Academie des Grand Chaumiere, so this is really a very special and historic site! Hotel & Room: On the website of the hotel you can see that they offer 3 room types (classic, club & superior) and 4 ambiences (parisienne, comedienne, Man Ray & Ruhlmann). Before we booked, we asked per email about the ambiences of the different room types, especially the classic, and where told that all classic rooms are in the Comedienne style. If you arrive before check-in time or want to leave late after check-out, you can store your luggage safely in the hotel. They also offer an opportunity for refreshment (sinks, soap, towels and toilets) in the basement of the hotel for guests before check-in and after check-out. The staff was very friendly and helpful at any time. We stayed in a classic double on a higher floor. The roomâ€™s size was as indicated on the website, small, but with an absolutely lovely and well-planned interior and an extraordinary styling. Everything was very clean. The room had two windows towards the street, one from the room and one from the bathroom. Bathroom (shower, sink) and toilet were separated from each other. The bathroom had no door (which we also knew from Tripadvisor reviews), but a curtain to close the bathroom area towards the room. The noise coming from the Boulevard Montparnasse was a bit loud at nights, so if you like to have the windows opened at night, maybe it is better to use earplugs. There is a free internet access in the lobby. We absolutely loved this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A delightul hotel which enhanced our Paris experience greatly.”
Reviews.Author: travelbugsueToronto
Reviews.Content: After much research we booked this hotel. We were not disappointed in any way. Upon arrival we were greated by the owner Laurent and offered ice tea which was much appreciated in a warm day after an 8 hour flight and taxi ride. As we were early, he took our luggage and suggested where we might go to pass the time and which was in walking distance of the hotel. Upon return we went to our room and tasty macaroons were sent to our room. This was the beginning of a most delightful stay. We had breakfast every day which was both delicious and healthy and had tea on occasions after a busy day sight seeing. The hotel was close to major attractions and was in a wonderful section of Paris with many wonderful restaurants. The staff were excellent helping to arrange for car service, taxis, and making dinner reservations. Henri and Julia were outstanding and we enjoyed our visit with Laurent(the owner) who explained the history of the hotel to us. I wish we could have stayed longer(we were there 7 days) and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Paris and wanting to stay in the Latin Quarter. I will absolutely return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room & Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: AniWard
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2010 for 5 nights, as part of our honeymoon in France. We loved our hotel room-it was nice, clean and perfect in size. We stayed in the Ruhlmann room and there was a lot of space to store luggage and clothes. We also had a nice view to Boulevard du Montparnasse. The hotel is just a few blocks away from the Jardin du Luxembourg and is among a very interesting part of Paris. Touristy, yes, but nothing like the right side of the river. Many great restaurants in the area and lively neighborhood- close to many of the universities and Academies in Paris (hence the name). I would be happy to come back to the hotel- they were perfect for our trip and served us delish macaroons upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “It's the staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Scooney1967
Reviews.Content: Ok, I'm probably similar to most people reading this, I have stayed in hundreds of hotels round the world both with business and pleasure. I concluded that what makes this hotel so good, is the staff - they are simply very very good. One lady in particular (I think her name was Patricia, but I could be wrong) was very polite, welcoming and helpful. She recommended and booked 2 excellent restaurants for us, as did the gentleman on our first night, who was also excellent. If you stay here, you MUST eat at the restaurant Wadje (just across the road - the guy who runs it is incredibly helpful and passionate about what he does. The second he told me he came from Bordeaux, I let him choose the wine to suit our food. He did NOT let us down, it was perfect (and it wasn't even near the most expensive wine.) The other great resto was Le Timbre - 10/10 for food quality. A little on the small side, but in fact that added to the experience for me . Anyway, I digress. The truth be told, i would have only given the rooms 4/5 as it was small and it was a club room. BUT the staff would have got 6 if there were 6 stars, so I evened it out and gave 5 for both. I have just spent the last 3 days on biz in London. Very unpleasant as always in my book. I love genuine Londoners, who are normally very friendly, but the people who work in these hotels are awful. Sure, my room at The Rembrandt may have been better, but with the attitude of the staff so so different, give me the Academy et des Arts ANY day. If you own a hotel and are wondering why this hotel is number 4 in ALL of Paris on this site, start by looking at the attitude of your staff. Well done all concerned - a great visit. Paul (oh yeah, before I forget, if ur in Paris and it's sunny, you MUST take even an hour to just chill out at the Jardin de Luxembourg, which is an easy walk from this hotel. A calm oasis in a major world city - tremendous!)

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: JMC25
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Academies et des Arts. It's a botique hotel and is well-kept. Service was good, as we found the staff to be very helpful with any request (directions, dinner reservations, sights, etc.) - especially Henri, who went out of his way with recommendations (thanks Henri). Le Reminet for dinner was very good and had a nice (albeit cramped) atomosphere. Rooms and bathrooms were decent size by Paris standards and our standup shower even had body sprays. The hotel is just off a main street which is good b/c it's relatively quiet. It's also in a nice neighborhood with many cafes and restaurants (Luxembourg gardens also nearby). L'Atelier near the metro stop is a good place for lunch and people watching. We liked the location and the fact it's very close to the metro. Good stay and we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel-Great, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: katielenora
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from Paris and I have to say this Hotel was the best hotel I have ever stayed at in Europe. I read reviews saying that the rooms were small, but they were by far the biggest rooms we have ever stayed at in Europe. The room was extremely clean and well maintained and the bathroom was great! The staff, from the front desk to the porter, was extremely friendly and helpful providing us with maps and directions to anywhere we needed. Patricia was especially sweet! I will definitely stay there again and would recommend it to even the "pickiest" traveler!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service from staff who couldn't be more helpful”
Reviews.Author: Lagardo007
Reviews.Content: Although the weather was unseasonably cold and damp, the service we received from the staff helped to make our four day stay memorable. No surprises regarding the size of the room but its the quality and cleanliness that counts. The location in Montparnesse proved ideal for getting around the sights - three Metro stations within easy walking distance. Many restaurants and bistros to choose from - hotel management were very helpful in providing advice and assisting with bookings. Getting around on the Metro seemed much easier than London's underground and its well worth pre-buying a multi-day pass. Similarly, if your travelling light there is a good rail link to and from the airports (wouldn't recommend this if you have hefty suitcases as trains can get crowded as you get closer to the centre of Paris).

Reviews.Title: “Gem in Paris; just recommended to a friend and her husband heading to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: LilJetsettter
Reviews.Content: Worth every cent! After a hard debate on which hotel we would stay at while in Paris my bestfriend and I finally decided on Hotel des Academies et des Arts, specifically after finding this little gem on tripadvisor. We bought multiple tour guide books and researched the hotels listed in those and decided to abandon the books and roll the dice with this adorable boutique hotel (not listed in any books). Needless to say I am very happy with the choice and was pleasantly surprised. The hotel's dÃ©cor was very creative, considering the art district to which it's located. We stayed in the standard room and yes it was small, but you have to expect that in Paris. If two girls with two large suitcases packed for a 10 day trip can make this room work anybody can! The hotel is conveniently located to multiple metro stops, so getting to the major touristy spots are only moments away. The neighborhood was very safe and I was not at all worried about pickpocketing as in other major areas. There was an adorable cheese shop just a block away from the hotel and my friend and I packed cheeses, a baguette and other little treats for a picnic we had on our day trip to Versailles. At night the hotel staff leave homemade macaroons which were fabulous and added a great touch. After reading other's reviews on tripadvisor we made sure to ask the hotel staff to make us dinner reservations at Le Timbre (which was in both of our tourguide books) which is a mere few blocks from the hotel. The food was amazing and the atmosphere a lot of fun. The other night we stayed the hotel staff made reservations for us at another great spot near the Pantheon. I would definitely pick this spot again if I returned to Paris and have already recommended it to my boyfriend's bestfriend and wife for their trip this upcoming winter.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem”
Reviews.Author: parispugs
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the basis of reviews and the fact that my doctor spent the whole of my appointment with her furnishing me with an in depth description of this totally fabulous boutique hotel they had stayed in in Paris. She even checked out the vacancies for me. I was not to be disappointed. The gorgeous decor, infallible staff and the close proximity to transport, sights and good restaurants made this a memorable stay. Ooh I forgot to mention the complimentary Pierre Hermes macaroons and the champagne when our tv wouldn't work. Wonderful, wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: markgLondon
Reviews.Content: Although not the cheapest hotel in Paris, we were seriously impressed with the Hotel des Academies et des Arts. Prior to our arrival, we had messed them around with our reservation, due to my work commitments, and had cancelled and uncancelled at least twice! But we were still greeted to the most lovely of welcomes. The staff were naturally friendly, fun and gave really excellent advice on restaurants, bars and other much valued information. We enjoyed the room, the hotel and the surrounding area, which was full of life and style.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: pvjirealnd
Reviews.Content: Loathe to praise as I might have difficulty getting a booking!! Staff are excellent . Great welcome. Nice style in the hotel and pleasant breakfasts. Convenient Location . Rooms not enormous but its Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MaxKent_England
