Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are smallish this hotel is excellent. The service is wonderful and the rooms are very comfortable and stylish. The breakfast is also excellent with very good quality croissants and coffee and lovely fresh fruit and yogurt. A very convenient location too. We would always stay here whenever in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: swallowslanding
Reviews.Content: This Boutique hotel is situated in the Artists/University district of Paris, very close to the Tour de Montparnasse. (Montparnasse Tower, worth a visit for the views...) Convenient, well appointed, clean, nice amenities, small compact rooms but then everything in Europe is on smaller scale when it comes to accommodations. Location was great and I would stay here again. The rate we selected included a Breakfast in their bistro area just off the lobby and was fruit, yogurt and Croissant and breads with fresh squeezed juice and excellent coffee. A great start to the day. Room amenities were good quailty, bed very comfortable, with old world charm in a modern updated fashion. A tasteful lobby with Concierge style service, an internet station for Guest use, as well as Library of Art books as this is an art hotel ! Tres excellente!

Reviews.Title: “Best service in Paris”
Reviews.Author: RAWELondon
Reviews.Content: Our room could only be described as "compact" (and ours apparently was not one of the smallest) but it was very well designed, as indeed was the whole of the hotel. With quirky features and none of the trappings of a four or five star chain, it may not be to everyone's taste, but for something different, with impeccable friendly service, don't bother looking anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite!”
Reviews.Author: debbie_steady_go
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel - small and friendly, cosy and well-decorated rooms and an absolutely divine breakfast. I'd definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, fab location”
Reviews.Author: foodissima
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter here for her 18th birthday treat, and I can honestly say it certainly was a real treat. Hotels in Paris are tricky, as there are so many poor options - but this one is a find. We arrived late, after midnight, thanks to Eurostar hold-ups but were instantly charmed by the very warm welcome and beautiful, fragrantly perfumed ambience, and our lovely room overlooking the atmospheric and historic rue de Grand-Chaumiere. Complimentary macarons were delicious, and the breakfast ditto if a little pricy. Beds were comfy, room cosy, quiet and warm in a freezing Paris February, and we could ask for nothing more in terms of helpfulness and friendliness of the lovely reception staff. You don't get much space, but that's normal in Paris! Piped music in the reception area was my only quibble - also sadly normal in Paris hotels...more's the pity. The line 4 metro is just across the road, taking you everywhere you want to go, and the Jardin de Luxembourg a few minutes' walk away,via the buzzing Cafe Vavin for coffee. Lots of interesting shops and foodie places nearby too. Thank you for surpassing our expectations, Hotel des Academies!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Times a Million”
Reviews.Author: StrawberryPicking
Reviews.Content: Loved loved loved this hotel. My boyfriend and I stayed here for a four day trip to Paris. The first minute inside the hotel, the staff were so welcoming and helpful. You instantly felt like you were in a hidden gem. I don't know if I have a bias, but I think that food in Paris has something in it that makes it amazing. Thus when we found out there were bakeries around the corner, it was easy to over indulge. The space in general within the hotel was kind of tight, but supposedly that's kind of standard in European hotels. I felt that it was perfect for what we needed. We stayed in the Superior Room, which is easy to say a valid and justified name. And to aid the welcoming experience, they give you macaroons, which tasted wonderful. As said before, this hotel is a hidden gem, so don't expect to find the greatest shopping centres and tourist sites around the hotel. However, if you jump on a 'hop on, hop off' tour bus, you will find yourself inside of Paris in no time. My boyfriend and I do plan on going to Paris again in a few years and would love to stay there again. I miss it already....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Extremely Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: skr_11
Reviews.Content: Great location and not bad value for money either. I pulled up outside the front door in my car and before I could blink, the staff were at my side, asking if I had a reservation and taking my bags inside. Directions promptly given to the nearest car park, Fantastic! Good suggestions for where to walk in the evening as well as where to eat, based on my choices! Will return! Only negatives were that the room was not huge, but if I want a huge room, it will cost me and also the basin taps. When I mentioned this, the chap at reception said that they were seriously considering replacing them.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MHH1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in January and loved it.Staff were courteous and helpful and room was well decorated and spotlessly clean.Great location and some really nice cafes and restaurants nearby.Will certainly use again and would have no hesitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, covienant location, great service and nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: grout
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in January and from the moment we walked in we knew we had found a great hotel. As with any hotel it is the staff that give the hotel a good friendly feeling which this hotel has in spades. Laurent and his team were so very helpful with information on the city and where to eat locally, and as usual their English was miles better than my French. Our room was not huge but very well appointed and comfortable and everything worked well - free wifi as well! We will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: trubal
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, on 3 metro lines and the RER to CDG airport and lots of cafes and shops around. Service was fantastic and we'd particularly mention Julia who was a delight. Rooms are small as I've experienced in Paris but have been refurbished and have a lovely feel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel- Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: chantalpearse
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel after reading excellent reviews on trip advisor and were definitely not disappointed. On arrival we were greeted by an extremely helpful and friendly staff member, who was able to check us into our room early and then gave us directions and really helpful information about the local area and transport. A restaurant was recommended to us for that night, a small italian which was excellent also. Everything about the hotel was lovely and our trip was made a lot better by the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff for whom nothing was too much trouble. We would definitely stay here again, as it is very close to all major metro lines and there are lots of lovely restaurants and things to see in the area. Macaroons were absolutely delicious also!!! Excellent hotel and excellent value for money. Would not get the service we received in a large chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,great staff”
Reviews.Author: john_kefalonia
Reviews.Content: That was my first trip to France and it was an excelent choice. I was there with my family and this hotel was great. I want to say a big thanks to the staff of this hotel and i will go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Brilliant Location, Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: OliAtkinson
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights at Hotel des Academies et des Arts after seeing it ranked very highly on Trip Advisor. It certainly didn't disappoint. In a ludicrously expensive city, this cute boutique hotel represents great value. Although our room was small, it was immaculately presented, cosy and welcoming. The staff we encountered at the hotel were fantastic. They also offered two suggestions for evening dining; the first - Le Timbre- was a superb recommendation and one of the best meals I've ever eaten. The second recommendation - Closerie des Lilas -was a much 'posher' (read expensive) restaurant, although the food was nowhere near as good. All in all, a great hotel in an ideal place to explore a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed....”
Reviews.Author: LadyGaga38
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and booked the top category of room. It was lovely but take note..it is small! if you are a big/tall person it may feel too cramped there for you. Great district and local restaurant Le Timbre a 5 min walk from the hotel is well worth the visit - again small..so you will get used to the "cosy" feel of Paris!! Anyone reading this and thinking of transfer from CDG the taxi cost us 70 euro at rush hour and took 2hr10mins ! Also make allowances for queuing in Paris it takes HOURS!! If you like HN and Selfridges dont miss "Le Bon marche" (Paris equivalent)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nigelanne
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night recently, our third time in this hotel. Great location and lovely hotel. As always the staff were incredibly helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “small and expensive”
Reviews.Author: susanandersonLondon
Reviews.Content: This is a well designed boutique hotel in an interesting area of Paris. The rooms are very small - not for the claustrophobic. It is expensive, which we expected, but we were disappointed by the meaness - a second pot of coffee at breakfast cost an additional 8 euros ( on top of 15 euros each) and 2 cups of tea brought to the room 9 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little boutique hotel in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: HKMcP
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel from Trip Advisor and wasnt disappointed. It was my partners 40th birthday and I was looking for something different and quirky. It was that and more. The staff were excellent and extremely helpful and the location was great. Most of the major sites were within a 15 min walk and with 3 metros nearby getting around was not a problem. We loved the hotel and would go back tomorrow. Have no hesitation in recommending this as a great place to stay if you are looking for something out of the ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel in a fabulous area”
Reviews.Author: TravelFansCambridge
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful long weekend at the Hotel des Academies et des Arts. We chose this hotel after seeing the positive reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. We booked a superior room which was spacious enough by Paris standards, not sure if a smaller room would have been as acceptable, although the innovative decor may well compensate for the lack of space.The staff could not have been more helpful, the welcome on our arrival was greatly appreciated after a long journey. We enjoyed staying in the area, away from the tourist traps and noisy nightlife. The Metro is only two minutes walk away for getting out and about and there are so many restaurants within a short walk that you do not need to venture far to find somewhere to eat within your budget. The only reservation we had was that, although the breakfast was of a very high quality and delicious, there was no choice of fruit juice, fresh fruit and yoghurts. We were served with exactly the same food each morning...fine for three days but this could become annoying if you were staying longer, particularly as breakfasts were costly at 16 Euros. Overall a very enjoyable visit, we were impressed with this hotel and would not hesitate to recommend it to our friends. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little gem!”
Reviews.Author: ANSA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a conference in Paris. To begin with, the location is perfect, Montparnasse is a beautiful area of Paris, and there are three metro stations very close by. Also close by is Montparnasse tower, which I definitely recommend to get great views of Paris. The hotel is very beautiful and charming with the staff very attentive and friendly. The rooms are very small, and you have to be careful in that though we paid for the (slightly) bigger rooms they did try and fob me off with one of their smallest rooms, though I insisted on the room being changed. Once it was, I was very happy, as I prefer a separate en-suite, and in the room before there was no door to the bathroom, so if you don't like rooms like that, be sure to specify to the hotel. The rooms are beautifully decorated and very clean. My room even had small balcony, though it was too cold to use it. There is free wi fi and you get complimentary macaroons on arriving at the hotel. Everyone speaks english and couldn't be more helpful. We had the continental breakfast some mornings, but it was very steep at 16Euros. Overall though, had a lovely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect boutique Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: RichardFlorida_9
Reviews.Content: By far my best experience in Europe! We were welcomed by Henry, who helped us during all our stay with constant great recommendations on where to eat, what to see, and how to get anywhere (the hotel has 3 metro stops only a few minutes away). Location was great, among the locals but walking distance from many sites! The hotel has been recently renovated with perfect "french taste", and art is everywhere around you, in the lobby and in your room. Rooms are not huge, as expected in Europe, but very well organized. To sum it up: great location, great staff, great room. We will be back!" Richard, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in a very good area”
Reviews.Author: jbutter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best that we have used in Paris. It has been recently rennovated and evrything feels very new. We arrived very late and were met by friendly staff. Our room was small, but relative to Paris quite generous in size with a well equiped bathroom. The rooms at night are very quiet and the beds very comfortable. The hotel is in arrondissement (region) 6 of Paris which is a very arty area coupled with lovely residential areas. Like others, we felt the breakfast was very good but a little pricey at â‚¬32 for two. To summarise, its a small hotel, with very friendly staff and has an almost homely feel to it which very mmuch appeals to us.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: RomaNewyork
Reviews.Content: next to the centre Staff are professional quiet, very good service room good but small not to expensive

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Golferboy18
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights there recently in a double club room and then returned 4 days later and stayed 5 nights in a superior room. For a short stay the double club is fine but we really noticed the difference with the superior room for our 5 night stay. We had breakfast delivered every morning to the room and it was fabulous to sit in their comfy robes with the window open looking over the roof tops and sipping cafe au lait with great croissants, breads, jams, yogurts, juice etc. Room was always very clean and the bed was great with nice duvet. Two english channels on TV kept you up with the news and there was an English newspaper in the lobby every day. Staff were always very helpful and book restaurants and gave good advice. Best part is the neighbourhood as you don't have to walk more then a few blocks to find great eating at all price levels. Some of the most famous 'brasseries' like La Coupole, La Rotunde, and The Dome are within two blocks. Food at La Rotunde very good and filled with locals. Cafe Vavin great lunch spot as was the pizzaria across from it. Le Timbre was very good for one night but everyone was a tourist in our long table of 12. All in all a great hotel in a great locale.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in room”
Reviews.Author: jennywal
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying in this hotel after first discovering it when researching hotels during our 2007 stay in Paris. Based on the previous reviews and photos, I thought I was saving our best hotel for last. Our check-in was wonderful. The receptionist was friendly and helpful, and the welcome ice tea and macaroons were greatly appreciated after a long day of travel. We booked the middle grade of rooms, so while I was not expecting a large room, I could not imagine what the size of the lowest grade of rooms was. Our first hotel room in Paris was small, but we kept the curtains open to allow the outside space to make our room feel larger. When opening our window in this hotel, we were greeted with a wall. Trying to stay positive, I thought that at least it would be quiet at night when sleeping with our windows open. That didn't happen since the people staying below us chose to use the courtyard as a smoking area. The smoking along with spotlight that was kept on to showcase the painting on the outside wall made up keep our windows closed and the curtains drawn. This only contributed to our room feeling cramped and dark. That being said, we peeked into the neighboring room while it was being cleaned. It was the EXACT opposite of our room. It was light, airy, large, and open. I would definitely choose to stay at this hotel, but would pay for the highest grade of rooms. This was our most expensive hotel during our trip, and was the smallest and my least favorite. I feel like we probably had the worst room in the hotel, so I can't fathom what the lowest grade room looks like. So if considering this hotel, pay the extra to stay in the larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a romantic minibreak”
Reviews.Author: SM0712
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at L'Hotel des Academies et des Arts for our 5th wedding anniversary. My wife booked it as a surprise and was nervous that I wouldn't like it as I am basically very fussy, like nice things and am generally high maintenance. However, the hotel was exactly what I was looking for in a chi-chi boutique hotel for a mini break. It was very easy to get to from Gare du Nord - about 15 stops or so but they go by very quickly so didn't take long at all. We then were able to leave our bags at the hotel when we arrived, and they were super helpful, showing us the less touristy places to visit. Without prompting, they also confirmed our restaurant booking for the evening, had put our bags in our room when we got back and booked us a cab to take us to our evening meal. When we got back, they have a beautiful little bar to sit in, where you serve yourself from the "honesty bar" - great touch which made it feel as though it was a (very stylish) home from home. The room we had was perfect, very stylish decoration without being ridiculous. The bed was super comfy, the bathroom had a lovely shower and bath. They even arranged for my wife's makeup to be sent back to us when we discovered we'd left it behind when we got home. All in all perfect for a romantic minibreak.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jgalt60
Reviews.Content: Great little boutique hotel on a small quite side street off rue de Montparnasse and near a host of cafes. Great concept with art work in the elevator changing as you ascend/descend and through the stairway. Staff is very nice and helpful and all speak English well (I did not get any names but the blond woman at the desk each day was especially helpful). Little bit of a way to the major sites but easily accessible by subway (right around the corner) or a great walk through the Jardine du Luxembourg (if you like to jog in the morning this a great place), Latin Quartier and St. Germain and the Left Bank. Room was more than adequate size and well decorated with windows that open. Only con that I can think of is there is no view but this is very minor point and certainly not to be expected at this price point. Very nice experience-would definately stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic French Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Psychiatric
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just got back to Oz after 10 days in Paris. We stayed at des Academies the entire time, it was fantastic! - Location, location, location. Just off Blvd Montparnasse, 2 minutes from Luxembourg Gardens (where I proposed), a short stroll to the Montparnasse Tower (great Parisiene views from the top, great shopping at LaFayette below). We walked to many tourist places (Notre Dame, Louvre, Tower, Champs, Sorbonne, Pantheon, Hotel des Invalides, Concorde, Latin Quarter, etc) but there are multiple metro options nearby for those less fit. The staff were amazing, all of them. Helpful in every way, encouraging, offering suggestions and directions. Even helped me with my limited french. Now there's a point... most Parisiennes have good English, but appreciate the effort by visitors to respect their culture and language. We found the locals very friendly and helpful. Cool, chic, relaxed - this is a culture comfortable with itself, where the origins of modern democracy emerged from the streets. They gave the statue of liberty to the US, for goodness sake. The in-house breakfast is a treat. The decor is art-inspired, with small statues suspended in the 5 floor stairwell and paintings visible through the glassed lift. There are great local cafes & restaurants. Le Timbre is a local gourmet experience (but book first). Best gourmet restaurant was L'Rois de L'Isle. Every mouthful was like I was in the 'Babet's Feast' movie. As a base to visit further afield locations (Canal Saint-Martin, Disneyland, Versailles, Giverney, Le Peuse) it was terrific. If you are going to versailles, look for the Queens Hamlet (for a balanced insight). I would definitely stay there again. The room was comfortable and well appointed. Great shower and bath. One pointer though... don't pack a cat. You'll never swing it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Camy90
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Paris where we stayed for 9 nights in our honeymoon. We found out about Hotel des academies et des arts at this website, and since the reviews were so good we decided to stay there. It was a very good choice. The hotel is very clean, well decorated and the staff is so worderful, specially Henry! Always ready to give you the best tips! It is in a very good location with a lot to do, and not so touristy. The breakfast is a little expensive ( 16 euros) but sooo good. But there's a great boulangerie really close( Rue Vavin) where you can have it for much less. Would stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: parsons517
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 days for our honeymoon and were not dissapointed. From the moment that we walked through the door we were greeted by a wonderful smell that was very welcoming and very helpful staff. The man on reception sat us down and pointed out that the hotel is only a couple of minutes walk from 3 different metro lines for the major attractions. He gave us a map and indicated how close the hotel is to the Jardin du Luxembourg and St Germain - literally around the corner. The hotel's location was not overly touristy with many locals out for dinner in the evenings. There is a good range of restaurants nearby and a great atmosphere of being able to sit outside to eat and people watch. The room was on the small side but not unexpected for Paris. It was, however, lovely and very well decorated, as was the rest of the hotel. We would not hesitate to stay here agin.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic/ friendly Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotsauceathlete
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great part of Paris, vibrant and full of great cafes/ restaurants. The staff here are some of the friendliest and most attentive I have ever encountered. The rooms are pretty tiny but this is Paris and you expect that. Be sure to try the coffee macaroons from downstairs as they are excellent. This is a really nice place stay in Paris

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay - really lovely”
Reviews.Author: sarahtom33
Reviews.Content: loved everything about this place - stylish and well located. food was lovely and staff wonderfully french everything we could have wanted and a little bit more...1st rate

Reviews.Title: “Good but could be better”
Reviews.Author: Cornishjo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay here. Been to paris the last 3 years running, and booked this because of the reviews , location and as Hotel luxembourg Park were already fully booked (we stayed there last year) Location of the hotel is fab, Room although nice and unusually decorated were pretty tiny, we had a club room which was smaller than the standard room we had last year at Luxembourg park, and pretty dark as the window pretty much faced a brick wall the tv also didn't work on the last day which was a bit of a pain and couldn't be rectified(not their fault mind)The staff were really helpful with reservations for dinner etc, but one major annoyance was that on our last evening we mentioned to reception that we had an early flight and would need to leave by 7am and could we get some breakfast first, were told this was not possible as the lady didn't turn up till 7.15. Have booked the same flight home the past 3 years and both Hotel sezz and Luxembourg parc's night staff were happy to organise breakfast for us before the other staff arrived. (I mean we are talking a few pastries and a hot drink not some major cooked breakfast) Later checked again with another member of staff whether it would be possible to have a cup of Tea/coffee before we left and again were told it was not possibleas too early. Find this absurd as drinks are said to be able at all timesand surely they must be able to cater to business travellers with early starts etc. We had also already paid for breakfast to be included which made it even more so irritating. As i say fab location and great staff apart from the breakfast problem but the Hotel luxembourg park beats it by miles for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel & best shower ever!!”
Reviews.Author: ButtonandBee
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, one of the nicest I've ever stayed in. Friendly staff, beautiful rooms, interesting design & the best shower I have ever had - after a days walking round Paris it is very important!! Was taken here for a romantic weekend & it could not have been more perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A gem !!!”
Reviews.Author: Italyl0ver
Reviews.Content: Paris can be a very expensive place! Hotel des academies et des arts is of excellent value â€“ centrally located with very friendly staff! The rooms were very clean and the air conditioning worked very well. The location of the hotel was perfect - just a couple of minutes from Luxembourg Park and Saint Germain des PrÃ©s. It is very central, spotlessly clean and modern. Very helpful front desk. A special Thanks to Stephanie who was very nice and hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: multitraveler007
Reviews.Content: Great service, artsy room, and awesome Macarons from Pierre Hermes makes this the all around best Boutique Hotel ever. First, it is one of the more inexpensive hotels in Paris. Second, the employees are friendly and helpful unlike other bigger high-end hotels in Paris. Third, they brought fabulous macarons to our room as a part of their welcome, which we ate in less than two seconds. Yummy. The room has everything that you need, including a free large bottle of water, free wi-fi wireless internet, a mounted flat screen tv, and lovely toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “A veritable masterpiece”
Reviews.Author: Nomadico
Reviews.Content: My partner and I came to Paris for four days from Western Canada on a whim, to celebrate our 20th anniversary in this great city, visit a few museums, and have some special dinners out. We discovered the Hotel des Academies et des Arts through a web search and were enthralled by the name (we love art), the history and the location. The web site of the hotel is creative, informative and well descriptive. I gave them a call to book since I always prefer to "feel" the attitude on the other end, and the person on the phone was helpful and courteous. When we arrived at the hotel everything exceeded our expectations. This is a small boutique hotel, to be sure, and it may not offer sprawling suites or a fancy restaurant on the premises. But we adored out elegant, cozy room overlooking the Paris rooftops; we fell in love with the funky art that greets you around the building at every turn; and could not have been more pleased with the staff and the service. Over the course of our five nights there we met three or four different persons at the front desk and each of them was friendly, helpful and very knowledgeable. I spoke with them always in french, but that was not a determining factor as I heard them deal with English speaking clients just as amiably and helpfully. And lastly, the location of this gem of a hotel in the middle of artsy and trendy Montparnasse, literally adjacent to some of the most traditionally renowned restaurants that Paris can offer (Le Dome and La Rotonde are but a couple of examples), and within walking distance of the Seine and the historical centre, is another great quality. We could not recommend this hotel more highly; we do travel a fair bit and out of dozens of hotels where I have stayed I would be hard pressed to name a better one.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect boutique hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: StoppingForPhotos
Reviews.Content: This well-decorated hotel was slightly off Montparnasse Street, in a good location with nearby metro stations. It lived up to the other reviews on Trip Advisor, though the room was a bit smaller than I had imagined. The breakfast was delicious, though 16euros a person, which was a little pricey. The staff was very helpful and friendly, though their reccomendation for La Rotunde as an authentic French "family" restaurant was not very good - - over rated and over priced. Neither of us enjoyed our dinners at all (though dessert was good!). We did enjoy a steak frites place that was nearby - le Relais de l'Entercote.

Reviews.Title: “Not your usual Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: SkyeTraveler
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was in the 6th arrondisement and I needed to be near the university. It's actually further south than I'd anticipated -- it's practically in the Montparnasse neighborhood. But it's close to several subway lines. In fact, it's a direct trip on the number 4 (?) line from the Gare du Nord. (Beware, though -- sometimes there are REALLY long lines for metro tickets at that station.) And I grew to like the neighborhood a lot, with its iconic cafes (Le Select.), and of course the Jardin du Luxumbourg. Small rooms are a given in Paris. All you can hope for is that you get one that's thoughtfully and cleverly designed, preferably recently refurbished, with a decent bathroom. This one delivers on all counts. As a bonus, the bed was a real double and not two twins jammed together. And there's proper air conditioning! Very welcome on an unusually hot July day. Internal noise is also usually a problem in these hotels. If you have inconsiderate fellow guests -- well, tant pis, I guess. But that's not the hotel's fault. The front desk is very friendly. Not coldly polite, but actually warm and smiling. Special thanks to LOUISE, who helped me with a computer printing problem at 11 in the evening! (I had a presentation the next day, so I was immensely grateful.) Continental breakfast was nice but never varied. I think that's usual in France. Only two slip-ups. I came back one day to find my door had not been properly closed by the cleaner (fortunately, nothing was missing from the room -- it always pays to put valuables in the safe, though.) And the turndown service wasn't done on one out of the three nights I stayed.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: NortheastRasm
Reviews.Content: We found this boutique hotel through Trip Advisor and our stay here was part of the reason our holiday was so wonderful! The staff was very warm and knowlegeable.! Our room was comfortable, very clean and quiet. The design of the hotel and flow into the rooms was very welcoming. We were in a great location with proximity to sight seeing and many metro stops . It is located off Montparnasse Blvd. which turned out to be an added bonus due to all the restaurants and shops. We would definitely stay here on a return trip and recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: ytoledano
Reviews.Content: We just came back from France and our stay at Hotel des academies et des arts was great. The location is great - it's near 3 different subway lines. The concierge was extremely helpful. We used their services at least 15 different times. Rooms are small, but that's to be expected at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel in a great area of Paris...”
Reviews.Author: LADilettante123
Reviews.Content: Fact: Rooms are small, but if you plan on going out most of the time anyway, this hotel is great! The area is south of St. Germain de Pres...walking distance to all quaint shops, great bakeries, restaurants, shopping , parks, subway etc. It's the best since you can go walk all the way up to the Louvre and environs, and everything in the Left Bank. Love it since this area is quaint, where locals actually live and play... The staff are the best, spoke English, warm and helpful. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Artsy little hotel, useful location”
Reviews.Author: polena
Reviews.Content: I've been there with my husband for our honeymoon. Everything has been great. Room wasn't big at all, but if you want to sit in your room the whole day being in Paris - there's something wrong with you :) Otherwise, the decor is nice, as well as the furniture. Also free Wi-Fi (you need to obtain the password at the reception). The hotel is close to 3 metro stations - Raspail, Rue Notre Dame des Champs and Montparnasse, so, 3 different metro lines, which is very useful - we rarely had to change lines when going somewhere. The staff is very helpful, and speaking surprisingly good english. "Le Timbre" restaurant (if I'm not mistaken, it's rated 3rd among all restaurants in Paris on TripAdvisor) is close. I also advise going to Wadja reastaurant, which is just across the street from the hotel - huge list of wines and very good roasted peaches with basil. Overall, we enjoyed our stay very much. Will probably be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in Montparnasse.”
Reviews.Author: CS01
Reviews.Content: Back-tracking a bit here as this stay was 2 years ago. Didn't realize I hadn't reviewed, but felt I should since we had such a great stay. This was our first trip to Paris and we had no idea where to stay. We came across this hotel on Tablet and thought we'd give it a whirl. Great choice. This hotel is so convenient. When we hopped off the subway at the Vavin stop, we were mere steps away. We checked in and found the hotel to have a very contemporary feel. Our room was small but adequate. This is not a knock as we have stayed at other hotels in Paris and small-ish rooms are the norm. Though small, it was well appointed. Walking out of the hotel, you're surrounded by so many things, again a convenience of this hotel. You're right at the intersection of Raspail and Montparnasse, so you're surrounded by shops and restaurants. You'll also find yourself situated walking distance from Gare Montparnasse, perfect if you're looking to take a day trip to Versailles as we did. Really just an overall splendid stay. Great location, great staff, and well-maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel des Academies et des Arts is perfection”
Reviews.Author: zink920
Reviews.Content: Most of my traveling has been in the United States and I am a hotel snob. I like rooms that are spacious enough to roller skate in with all the amenities. I have only traveled to Europe once before thirteen years ago. That said, I have to say that the Hotel des Academies et des Arts is unique in everything. The service is very personalized and the hosts inquire often if your stay is what you had hoped for. The rooms are tiny but immaculately clean and nicely decorated. The bed was very comfortable and I slept well the five nights I stayed. The hosts will be happy to give you directions to any attraction or area you are interested in seeing or will guide you locally to a restaurant or cafe for a bite to eat. I was not disappointed with the recommendation I received. I had breakfast delivered to my room every morning I was there. I looked forward to it every day it was so delicious and satisfying. Within minutes of calling to ask for breakfast there was a knock on the door from a very pleasant young woman who brought the tray into the room and left. You must try the breakfast at least once during your stay. If you are planning a visit to Paris look no further for a hotel The location of this hotel is close to several attractions such as the Louvre and Notre Dame cathedral. There are several metro stations close by. I chose to walk everywhere. When I visit Paris again I will be staying at the Hotel des Acadamies et des Arts.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: golfmom
Reviews.Content: The room we had was very small. any room that ends in a 3 is the smallest they have. I must say the staff is great. Personally I didn't care for the location but I can see how you could.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, fantastic personal service!”
Reviews.Author: Stipey99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights, and the rooms were very nice. Great service from the hotel staff.. Recomended fantastic restaurants, and gave us many good tips on where to go and when to go there. Will definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: vagabondwoman
Reviews.Content: A thank you to the staff at this lovely hotel. Excellent service, especially Henry, who works at the front desk during the day. The perfect English, friendly manner, and exceptional service make this hotel a standout to me. The owners seem to have paid attention to the details, and they work together very well, creating a stylish and comfortable hotel. I was given a choice of two rooms at check in. Was a nice gesture, and enjoyed being able to select the full size tub in the room. The location was very good, making it a great place to see the sights of the city. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Unique and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: AnnaParrott
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful and friendly! Our room was clean and big enough for 2 people to be comfortable. We stayed in room 22. I would definately stay here again. It was a short walk to the beautiful Jardin's of Luxemburg.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to reputation”
Reviews.Author: Kenpasadena
Reviews.Content: I loved the Hotel des Acadamies et dest Arts. I arrived on Sunday afternoon, and they apologized that the room wasn't ready yet because of a lot of late check outs. They send me on my merry way towards the museums and a great cafe recommendation for a late lunch. When I returned, my luggage had been taken to my room. The room was not too small and not too big - I believe in the US, we would call this a boutique hotel. The decor was modern, tasteful and lots of conveniences in the room like storage, television and internet and free wi-fi. I stayed in a club room that overlooked the steet. It was very quiet. The bathtub was huge and a nice regular shower also attached. Great bath products that they refreshed every day. Besides the great room, the service was wonderful. I asked about restaurants in several parts of town and they were helpful. I had walked by En Cherche Midi, an Italian restaurant that Gladis de Laurentis raved about on the Foodnetwork. They made me a reservation, and it was really really fabulous. The breakfast was wonderful as everyone has said. I also really enjoyed the Monparnasse neighborhood. It was nice, not too touristy and close to everything. The Varin Metro station is steps away from the hotel. I don't know how you rate thousands of hotels in Paris. However, Academies is definitely a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great stay, great overall!”
Reviews.Author: CLT76
Reviews.Content: We checked in after staying at a different hotel on the right bank and we had a great experience. The staff was wonderful from day one, with great suggestions, recommendations, and overall service. Atmosphere is outstanding, with very chic and clean rooms, thoughtful decorations, and amazing attention to detail. The location just a couple of blocks from the Luxembourg Gardens is outstanding and allows for quick access to all areas of Paris. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone considering a vacation in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - so glad i checked with Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: thegirlfromglasgow
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for our 10th anniversary 2 weeks ago, and checked with Tripadvisor for recommendations - we weren't disappointed. The hotel was brilliant - very clean, lovely decor. The service was like the decor, very individual and put you at ease. Although the rooms are small, it was Paris and we were aware of that before you went. We had plenty of room however. Every good review that I had read about the hotel was true. The location was fantastic - we checked the hotels website for directions, and it was 5 minutes from the RER train direct from charles de gaulle airport. You are also very close to 2 metro stations, so it was well located to explore Paris. Although there is a bustling neighbourhood, the rooms were so quiet. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at hotel des academies et des artes and will definitely recommend it. If I ever go back to Paris, I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: KathleenLatlip
Reviews.Content: First of all the staff was amazing and extremely helpful. They welcomed us warmly and immediately showed us a map and where all the great places to go were. The location was perfect - walking distance to everything. The room was perfect and the bed comfortable. They even let us pick which room we wanted! The hotel is small so they take great measures in details. The bathtub was the BEST!!! After a long day of walking, I loved coming home and taking a bath in this deep tub. There is a computer on site where you can get online which was VERY helpful for us making reservations for other travel. The hotel located right next to Jardin De Luxembourg, which in my opinion is the MOST GORGEOUS park in Paris! Blew the Jardin de Tuillerie out of the water. When we were ready to leave the staff went the extra mile with helping me book shuttle service to the CIA airport. I would Definitely stay here again. Make sure and check out the Cuban place around the corner!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to a perfect honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: brlyons
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so different and beautiful. If you appreciate artwork, then you'll love this hotel. The staff is warm and friendly. The rooms are pretty, but not that spacious. Once we got the hang of the multi-jet shower, we loved it! The location was tough to find. It was on a sidestreet that was difficult to find. We wandered a while looking for it and no one seemed to know the street. I would ask the concierge for the nearest main intersection before you come here. It's in a great neighborhood, too!

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: clairelouisejohnson
Reviews.Content: I have just returned with my boyfriend from a 5 day trip to Paris after staying in the Hotel des Academies et des Arts and couldnt fault our stay. On arrival we were upgraded to a superior room and were allowed to check in immediately despite arriving three hours earlier than the usual check in time. We received complimentary macaroons on arrival to our room, which despite not being huge, was spotlessly clean, with fresh towels and toiletries provided each day. I would recommend having a breakfast in the hotel at least once. Fresh fruit, yoghurts, juice and pastries of every kind! The staff were incredibly helpful, offering advice on restaurants in the area, places to visit and on one occasion walked down the street with us to point out a metro station! The hotel is in a great location, surrounded by cafes, restaurants and shops. It is only a ten minute walk to the Luxembourg gardens (which are beautiful on a sunny day) and the Notre Dame Cathedral. There are plenty of metro stations located nearby which provide easy access to the Eiffel Tower, Monmartre, Champs Elysees and the Louvre. La Rotonde restaurant (just around the corner from the hotel) is a must for an evening meal or for crepes and cafe du lait in an afternoon! If i was to return to Paris, i wouldnt hestiate to book a stay at the Hotel Academies et des Arts. Thanks for a fabulous stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to describe how wonderful it was - excellent hotel, fantastic location & truly first class service.”
Reviews.Author: Claire7900
Reviews.Content: Bonjour! I found Hotel des Academies et des Arts on Trip Advisor, my first use of the website. The reviews on the hotel were incredibly positive, so the hotel had a lot to live up to. We were not disappointed. About anything, so it's hard to know where to start really! The hotel itself is charming, relaxed, quiet and boutique with a special touch of luxury. The location of the hotel is superb and the hotel is well connected (either on foot or public transport to the airport and the rest of Paris.) (From Paris CGD, take line B RER train to Port Royal station, the hotel is 10 minutes walk along Montparnasse.) Great place. Clean and stylish (ours had a drawing of a man on the wall) rooms. Not massive (I would certainly say standard size for a centrally located hotel in a European capital) but plenty of room for two on a city break. The lobby of the hotel is a delight of it's own (and reflects the nature and personality of the rest of the hotel.) Comfortable, boutique furniture, sumptuous decor, surrounded by international newspapers, books and artwork. We were fortunate with the weather in that it was sunny every day we were there (three nights) but the lobby would be a great place to spend a couple of hours in a downpour. I noticed that the proprietor also ran a tea house (from the premises) with some fantastic classic and exotic teas available, so one could happily spend some time with a tea and book or just talking with friends. We arrived hours ahead of check in, after taking a 06:00 flight from London. The room was made available almost immediately and we were able to check in. Had we not been able to, the staff would have safely stored our luggage and also recommended where to spend the following hours until our room was ready. I have heard (via Trip Advisor) good things about the breakfast, although didn't find time to stop in and take it myself. Other reviews comment on how tasty it is, so next time, I hope to try it. The staff all deserve particular recognition - they were friendly, attentive, charming and English speaking, with the patience for me to try out sentences in French on them before I ventured out. They happily recommended (real French) places to go and relax and eat and drink and also readily provided a wealth of information on sights and orientation. I can't commend them enough. Despite having been born and living my early years in Paris, I haven't visited much as an adult and was not sure what to expect in terms of Parisian friendliness to a Brit. How wonderfully surprised I was. Without exception, I found Parisians to be charming, polite and helpful. I followed seasoned phrasebook advice and always started a conversation with a smile and a greeting (and departing comment) in French - and I attempted to continue a brief conversation (badly - I don't speak more than a smattering of words) and it was either this that generated such positive, enjoyable interactions or maybe it's just Parisian nature! Great people. I loved Paris and can't wait to return. And when I do, it will be to Hotel des Academies et des Arts! You will not be disappointed. I wish the staff at the Hotel des Academies et des Arts all the best for a long and sucessful future and based on their current quality of offering, they will surely have one. I hope to see you again soon. C'est *tres* bon!

Reviews.Title: “Small but great”
Reviews.Author: MelissasCabot
Reviews.Content: Awesome Hotel. Rooms are amazingly clean. A bit small though.

Reviews.Title: “Good things come in small packages”
Reviews.Author: Laptop_Dancer
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel only offers 20 rooms on five levels. It is located in the St Germaine precinct, a 10 minute walk from the gorgeous Bon Marche department store and surrounded by wonderful cafes, bistros and shops. Several metro stations are within a short walk, the closest being about 50m away. Each room is individually decorated. I know this because when I checked in I was shown four rooms so I could choose the ambiance that appealed most to me. The staff are very friendly and go out of their way to assist. The breakfast is a little expensive (certainly given the weak Australian dollar) and is not generally included in the room rate but it is delicious and worth indulging in. Complimentary internet access is offered both in the rooms and in the lounge area downstairs. A downside is the hotel does not have a fitness centre however the Luxembourg Palace is just around the corner and is perfect for a morning jog or walk. Aside from that, Paris is designed for walking so a gym workout is not essential.

Reviews.Title: “Born to top the charts!”
Reviews.Author: Seb_7
Reviews.Content: I stayed there about a year and a half ago, not long after opening. I explained then that this was the best boutique hotel in Paris, by far. They're doing even better now, with closer attention to details (breakfast, umbrellas, massage room, etc.). And as before, decoration, ambiance, location, beds, bathrooms, televisions, service, etc. remain top quality. I'll come back, again and again, for business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, stylish stay”
Reviews.Author: golsonic
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a two night stay at this excellent boutique hotel. Located in a quiet street very close to a Metro station, the transfer to and from Gare du Nord for Eurostar users is very easy. Great welcome at reception, lovely room, beautifully clean and with great art in the public areas as well as the bedrooms. Free internet access in the lounge. The room was fairly small, but had plenty of well-designed storage as well as good TV. We had one breakfast, at which service was immaculate: fruit, yoghurt, pastries etc. Breakfast can be taken up to to twelve, which is very handy for late risers. Staff very solicitous and helpful in providing dinner recommendations, and there are plenty of choices in the neighbourhood at all prices. Easy walking to St Germain with loads more bars, cafes etc. Overall, best small hotel we have stayed in for ages.

Reviews.Title: “every positive review on this hotel is true”
Reviews.Author: RFW
Reviews.Content: The hotel has small rooms but they are beautiful and the staff are magic. The hotel is in walking distance of everywhere of significance in Paris. I am 65 and not an athlete, so I can speak for the majority of people as far as distance is concerned. We had breakfast once during our three day stay, and it was the best we had in France for the money. One of the guys at the desk said to me that they had a lot to live up to with the positive reviews they had on Travel Advisor. He need not have worried, all of the positive reviews on this hotel are well deserved, and I say this mindfull of the fact that I have never had a bad hotel experience since consulting Travel Advisor. This hotel is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and friendly”
Reviews.Author: HMG2
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel room was small, it was very clean and stylish. The motif of the little white figures which permeates the hotel is fun and interesting! We had one painted on our bedroom wall :)The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was clean and modern. Common areas in the hotel were also decorated with flowers and candles which made for a relaxing and attractive atmosphere. The best thing about this hotel however was the staff. They were very friendly and were happy to recommend restaurants and places to visit. They also offered umbrellas when it was raining, and let us borrow a travel plug and an iron. We felt that nothing was too much trouble and were made to feel very welcome. The location of the hotel is excellent as it is close to a number of metro stops, the closest being Vavin, Notre Dame des Champs and Montparnasse Bienvenue. It is easy to reach the main sights using the Metro, and you can buy a "carnet" of 10 tickets for E11.60. The Galleries Lafayette is close by, as are excellent restaurants. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and would visit again if I returned to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drjsactown
Reviews.Content: Hotel des Academies and des Arts is a modern 20-room gem just south of the Luxembourg Garden. It is technically in the 6th Arrondissement but borders the 14th. The staff, Henri, Pierre, and others, were all welcoming and helpful. The hotel sits on a quiet Parisian street; Gauguin painted in an atelier on this street and this area continues to be popular with artists and students. We liked staying in an area that was not overrun by tourists. The major Parisian sites are all accessible by metro or by foot. There are at least 3 metro stops servicing major lines within a short a distance of Hotel des Academies. There is no shortage of tasty brasseries and cafes in the area. We became quite fond of Cafe Vavin which was several short blocks away; a typical Parisian cafe, this was a fun place to go for cafe au lait and breakfast. We recommend having the hotel's breakfast at least once (15 euros) for the experience of it, but you can get similar 'petit dejeuner' at Cafe Vavin for half the price. If you are looking for antiques, this is not the place for you. As the hotel is only a year old, rooms are modern and very clean. They are small as one would expect, but we travelled with 3 large suitcases and managed to find a place for everything. Our queen bed was very comfortable. There is free wi-fi in the rooms as well as a computer with access to the internet in the lobby. The common areas are decorated with attractive contemporary fresh floral arrangements. We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel des Academies et des Arts. For us, the highlights were chic decor, helpful English-speaking staff, charming neighborhood, and value.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: cherylstewart
Reviews.Content: A beautiful little hotel with the most fantastic staff. Our room was immaculate, new towels, toiletries etc every day. The staff were brilliant from suggesting the best places to visit in our time there to booking restaurants (v difficult with an adventurous eater husband and a pregnant, fussy wife!). So easy to get to, 2 minutes walk from Metro Station Vavin on line 4. We'll definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “One word: Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: P_K_2008Croatia
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this beautiful small pearl. The staff was super professional and fantastic: helped us with transportation, lost luggages, airport check in...and other infinite questions. The hotel is full of small beatiful detailes... The hotel is situated in a quite street without traffic just behind the corner of boulevard de Montparnasse and 10 min away from the imponent jardins du Luxembourg. Many parts of the city can be seen by feet.. The hotel staff recomended us to walk to the Louvre (instead of taking public transport) and the choice was the best!! Don't miss the incredible breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Happy before, during and after our visit!”
Reviews.Author: Ka0ru
Reviews.Content: Setting the size of the room aside (as it is Paris), it is a lovely hotel with excellent service. Before our departure, I wanted to book a restaurant for my wife's birthday. (It wasn't easy during the summer vacation period in Paris and with my poor command of French...) The hotel staff not only gave me thoughtful suggestions, but kindly made a reservation for me. More over, we got a room upgrade and early check-in upon arrival before noon. The hotel is full of art pieces from the lobby to the lift or stairway and of course to the guest rooms. Staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Breakfast is not cheap but worth the price. The story doesn't end here. My wife left her personal belonging at the hotel, only to realize it after arriving home. We exchanged a few e-mails and they were so efficient and helpful in sending it back to us. If you are looking for a small hotel with character and hospitality, and especially if you appreciate contemporary art, there is no reason not to choose this charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small, stylish and cosy”
Reviews.Author: touringscots
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with our hotel room, it was small but didn't feel cramped. The theme throughout the hotel was fun and unique. The staff were all extremely helpful with one concierge in particular who stood out for us as welcoming and sincere. We never ate in hotel simply because Paris had so much to offer! We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing small cozy hotel with great location and most friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MoscowMia
Reviews.Content: My english is not good enough unfortunately for description of this lovely hotel. But i deffinately think that is a very good choise for this money. Rooms are realy small, but it's PARIS. If you need to have 50 square meters - go to "four seasons". It's the city hotel and it correspond to the city size :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: PH109
Reviews.Content: To keep it short and sweet... Spent 6 nights here. Could not have been more satisfied with the property, service and staff at this price point. Would highly reccomend to people visiting Paris for the first time. Staff was MORE than willing to answer my endless questions. Thanks to everyone, especially the gentlemen who works the overnight and was extremely helpful! Hope to see you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “What all good small hotels should aspire to be”
Reviews.Author: ChrisH007
Reviews.Content: On top of all that has been said about the aesthetically pleasing decor, the great location, the beautiful breakfasts, and enthusiastically pleasant service, I would like to commend them on going the extra mile to make a special birthday celebration go like clockwork. In just three days, they organised 4 taxis for us, a limosine tour, confirmed and followed up on restaurant reservations, proposed a visit with the artist of the hotel, and gave us the impression that nothing would be too much trouble for us to do. Having some experience of such things, and executive service in business, I would have to say this was the most real, warmest, and least forced example of a personalised service I have ever experienced. If you have the money to spare - you are accessing a really top quality of service at a fairly moderate price and hence it deserves to be at the top of your shortlist. We upgraded the room of the person whose birthday it was. in practice this gave them an extra seating area, and a bath in addition to a shower. Worth it as a treat, though we were very happy with our smaller room, which though small was artistic in feel, and with quiet and fully functioning a/c.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Sandy_Dan_8
Reviews.Content: We stopped in Paris on our way to Italy for a 2.5 week honeymoon and were very pleasantly suprised by Acadamies et Des Arts. It's a fabulous hotel in a great location - close to everything you could possibly desire. The staff were very friendly and helpful and made us feel very comfortable and welcome. Rooms were small but nice and well decorated. Very clean, updated bathrooms/showers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: fasta
Reviews.Content: Our Superior double room here was just perfect, bigger than we expected and the free Wi-Fi was a great bonus. Beds were very comfortable and separate toilet was a nice touch. Breakfast was very French, but enjoyable consisting of juice, croissants and coffee. As it was so cold we would have loved a warm breakfast but it would be perfect in the warmer months. Staff were very warm and informative and made many enquires and bookings for us that were dealt with very professionally. Location was excellent, plenty of restaurants, lots of little boutique style shops and 2 minute walk to Vavin station. We would not hesitate to recommend to others and will stay here again on our return to Paris next year.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent - next to Vavin Metro”
Reviews.Author: weescottishterrier
Reviews.Content: The room assigned to us was very comfortable as per description. Typical compact Parisian hotel room but well laid out with a seperate wc and bath area. The hotel was superbly located with many attractions on your doorstep and walkable. The metro location was litterally across the road which made navigation smooth and easy. The hotel staff were all very friendly, with excellent English and a good sense of humour. They made sure they did their utmost to make our stay pleasent. Recommendations were given for eating and directions to a great jazz bar along with making bookings for Moulin Rouge. Only downsides were a dodgy keyboard in our room, which choose not to work and an entertainment charge which was not nearly as flexible as just having a standard sky package with MTV etc. I would recommend this hotel for a romantic two - three night getaway.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: AlisonScotland
Reviews.Content: We booked this after reading the reviews on TA and were not disappointed. The staff are really fantastic and so helpful. The hotel is in a great location and is well appointed and furnished. We will definitely be back...

Reviews.Title: “The Praise is Deserved”
Reviews.Author: Ninebarks
Reviews.Content: This boutique property deserves all the praise it has been getting. My wife and I stayed there for four nights in early July. Everything was as advertised, especially the friendliness of the staff. I had emailed the hotel that we would be arriving about noon and, although check-in is officially at 3 pm, they had made a special effort to have a room ready when we arrived. That was a real plus after hours on a plane. Henry, the day person at the desk, is especially nice and extremely helpful in all matters. I really recommend this hotel most strongly. And, by the way, when you ask for ice, they really give you ice! That is a real plus for me as it is for most Americans. This was our first trip to Paris, though we have both travelled through Europe extensively. I feel compelled to give new visitors to Paris a bit of a warning about the Underground as it generally receives unrestrained praise. Yes it works fine if you are knowledgeble about all the recent alterations. However, if you are not, be prepared for frustrations. For example, we wanted to take a riverboat cruise on the Seine and were told to take the number 6 (I think I am remembering the number correctly) in the direction of Charles de Gaulle Airport and were given directions to the Underground station. However, when we arrived, there were no signs indicating a that the #6 had a direction of Charles de Gaulle. All that was available was direction Nation and direction Etoile. Turns out the Etoile is Charles de Gaulle, but it took some research to find out. Similarly, we took a side trip which required we get a train at Gare de Lyon. We took a taxi there, but decided to take the Underground back as the map of the underground indicated that good old number 6 stopped at Gare de Lyon. We found the entrance to the Underground and need to head in direction Etoile (we had wised up at this point). But it seems that the platform for direction Etoile was closed for some reason, perhaps for repairs. Again, a frustrating difficulty for someone unfamiliar with the peccadilloes of the Underground. Other problems we found we that the maps of the Underground are not current, though station signs are. On a couple of occasion the maps showed the direction ending at a location but, evidently, the line had been extended so we could never find the direction shown on the map. Why they don't post easily readable lists of stations like the ones which are actually in every car is beyond me. In short, being familiar with the terrific maps of the Washington DC Metro, I sure wish the Paris Metropolitan would do the same. But, again, the hotel is great. You won't go wrong. And the free wireless access to the internet is a real plus for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: macca19
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, the staff are helpful & friendly and will give lots of advice on where to eat locally, maps for walking around Paris, travel advice for the metro,and lots of other local info. Our room...505 was not too small by Paris standards! we had a great view of the street, (typically parisian) from the double french windows with small balcony, and a good big shower room,with spa style shower. The room was very clean and air con was excellent. There are lots of resturants, bistros & cafes nearby so eating out for breakfast etc is not a problem. The location is not too prohibitive as the metro stop Vavin is only a minute walk from the hotel we loved Paris although found it to be expensive!!

Reviews.Title: “Compact and bijou”
Reviews.Author: WelshGas
Reviews.Content: Whilst I have to agree with all the positive comments in previous reviews, i.e. beautifully appointed rooms, freindly staff, close to the metro and on a very quite street just off Montparnase, I do feel the need to point out the fact that some of the rooms at least are a bit on the small side. There was barely room to store a couple of suitcases, it was only just possible to close the door whilst using the toilet and although the bath was beautifully designed, I'm afraid taking a bath was totally out of the question. That said, we did thouroughly enjoy our night here, I'm just a bit surprised that, at around 180 euros a night, ,most other reveiwers think it worth 5 stars,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: NoleChick93
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! The staff was so friendly and the location was wonderful. We stayed in room 33, which I would recommend requesting, it was a very good size room with two windows that opened up. The decor is modern and everything is recently renovated. A note to those traveling to Europe- we stayed at 5 hotels in four countries and NONE gave out wash clothes or hair conditioner! Two important things for a gal to have... so bring them with you. The rate we paid per night was $197.00 euro's per night (inclusive of taxes). The only downside to the hotel was that the elevator was very tiny, but most of the hotels over there have this issue. Overall, great place, great location, great staff... a great place to stay in Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: kiscovt212
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a stay at the Hotel des Academies et des Arts. I can't say enough wonderful things--great hotel, great decor, WONDERFUL and helpful staff who all speak perfect English, excellent location in the 6th (close to 4 Metro stops, the Luxembourg Gardens, countless bistros, cafes, bakeries and bars). The rooms are a bit of the small side, but since you're in Paris, who is really spending that much time in a hotel room when you have a beautiful city outside? The are decent sized for Paris, and very reasonably priced. There's continental breakfast available every morning in the hotel, but since it is 15 Euros/person, we ventured out every morning to a cafe or bakery for a croissant or crepe and saved a bundle. There's no bar or restaurant in the hotel, but since you're in such a great area, you can go just about anywhere and find a drik or a lovely meal. Try the Blue Sky Pub just down the street for late-night drinks...great crowd and staff. I would highly, 100%, without a doubt recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: boo99
Reviews.Content: many paris hotel overpriced but this hotel was not. staff willing to go the extra mile to make you comfortable and never expect a tip but i'm sure it is appreciated. great location next to the metro. bought the 3 day unlimited pass. away from tourist section. would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: senioroz
Reviews.Content: What a delightful hotel in the Montparnasse District with ready access to everything! Our room was a very comfortable size by Paris standards and the hotel decor throughout was welcoming and unpretentious. The room had a feeling of luxury and was complemented by the most wonderful shower encountered in our 6 weeks of travel! The service was excellent and the staff were genuinely warm and friendly and very helpful in pointing us in the right direction, making our stay all the more memorable. We will now look forward to our next return visit to Paris, and have no hesitation in recommending this hotel as an ideal place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: Aussie-in-HK
Reviews.Content: Hotel des Academies not only provided us with a fabulous stay in Paris but also ensured we are eagerly planning our next trip to visit ASAP! The design, decor, ambience, service provided by friendly staff and location of Hotel des Academies is wonderful. Although the rooms are 'cosy', their thoughtful interior design ends up making you feel like you're staying in a spacious, modern retreat. We loved everything about our stay with Hotel des Academies and in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Delightful”
Reviews.Author: scoobydoobie
Reviews.Content: After much research into where to stay for our first trip to Paris, we decided on this hotel and were extremely pleased. We stayed five nights and never got tired if it. The hotel is technically in St. Germain (6th Arrondisement) but is in the most southern portion of St. Germain and borders Montparnasse, therefore it's a bit more quiet (we didn't hear a peep at night and slept very well) while still being in a very convenient location, with easy access to the Metro and busses too. It's about a 20 minute walk to the Seine, through some beautiful blocks. The hotel was clean, modern, stylish, it felt very safe, and all of the staff we encountered were extremely pleasant. The bathrooms are nice and modern and while not huge, were certainly not simply closets. The bathrooms are well appointed with nice soaps and shampoos and even bath salts to use in the very clean bathtubs. The concierge recommended an excellent restaurant (La Timbre) and were always smiling and willing to help. We did not take advantage of the hotel breakfast since it's a bit pricey (15 Euro per person), especially considering that there are many good pastry shops and cafes within 1-3 blocks. Also the hotel is a mere 50 paces from a BNP Paribas bank, which is useful if you're a Bank of America customer since BNP Paribas partners with Bank of America such that Bank of America clients can use the BNP Paribas ATM to get cash completely free of any additional fees, very helpful to know. Overall this hotel was clean, stylish, relaxing, welcoming, and very comfortable. The rooms are on the small side, even the Double Club which we had, but we had plenty of room for luggage and even some nice shelves on which to unpack, and the coziness of the room was just perfect to come back to after an exciting but tiring day of hitting the pavement of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing weekend”
Reviews.Author: Shnibnib
Reviews.Content: Wow. What an amazing weekend my wife and I have just experienced. We went to celebrate our first wedding anniversary and we couldn't have hoped for a better place to stay. It's so easy to get to - straight there from Gare du Nord (metro line 4) and the hotel is literally around the corner. The hotel is clean, well decorated and themed (check out the lift) and the staff so helpful. Paris is not brilliant for vegetarians, but Anne-Sophie on reception decided to do some research for us and printed maps, names and numbers whilst we were out sightseeing. The surrounding area is full of cafes and brasseries. You get better value for money by eating breakfast at one of these rather than the hotel, but if you want a lie-in, the hotel breakfast is probably best as you can have it until midday. Overall a fantastic hotel which I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly convenient”
Reviews.Author: Rhys_M
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the hotel is incredibly convenient for anyone arriving via Eurostar to the Gare du Nord. It's a direct metro ride down to Vavin. The surrounding area is quieter than some of it's more central neighbours, but there are some lovely bars nearby for al fresco drinking and it's about a twenty-or-so minute walk down to the Latin Quarter via the beautiful Jardin du Luxembourg. The hotel itself is modern without being distractingly so and the staff are courteous and helpful. The rooms are modest in size, but bright and clean. As I think some other reviewers have mentioned, it is possible to sometimes hear people in the adjoining rooms, but unless you are a particularly light sleeper I wouldn't let this deter you from a really great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: NancyGWisconsin_USA
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights at the hotel based on reviews on this site and could not have been more pleased. The hotel is beautiful, wonderfully decorated and an excellent location. The room was completely comfortable, great beds, lots of pillows. The highlight is the staff, so helpful and friendly. Definitly wished we had more nights there. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Paris Experience”
Reviews.Author: Lapidus
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves it's ranking as one of Paris' best hotels. For service it must rival the "grand hotels" and in a great location too. We stayed 6 nights recently - a family of 4 from Australia with two teenage children. We could not have felt more welcome. With two teenagers the hotel thoughtfully gave us two rooms across from each other and by closing the fire door we could interconnect them. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff (they even helped my son with his schoolboy French) and they provided excellent restaurant and sightseeing suggestions that made our Paris trip especially memorable. On top of everything the breakfasts were really delicious. We would not hesitate to stay there again, I cannot speak too highly of it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Melanie24
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night only but it I was very pleasantly surprised. The staff is really friendly and helpful and the service is great. The room was very pretty, loved the classy decorations and the beds were fantastic! The location is very close to two metro stations. The area is nice also, close to Montparnasse and the Jardin du Luxembourg. I hope to stay there again and I truly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: romangate_wales
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for three nights in April 2008 after we read all the positive feedback on Trip Advisor. We had a wonderful stay - the hotel is well positioned very near Vavin Metro station which is on the purple number 4 line directly from Gare Du Nord which is useful for those arriving in Paris by Eurostar. On arrival we received a warm welcome from Henri. As it was our first time to the centre of Paris, he gave us tips on what to do, where to go and how to get there - he, and all the staff, were attentive, kind and professional. Luckily our room was prepared early so we could go to relax before venturing out to explore the area. The room was, as all reviews point out, not exactly huge - but exquisitly decorated, clean and the beds were large and very comfortable. The bathroom had a lovely big bath with powershower (great after being on our feet all day!) and were were lucky enough to have the first floor room with access to the small sitting area outside. Free internet access in the room and flat screen tv were a great addition, though, as usual on the continent, there were only two news channels - but then again, what the heck are you doing watching tv when the whole of Paris is on your doorstep to explore! The hotel is on a quiet street just off the busy Boulevard De Montparnesse with its plentiful eateries and cafes. Heading the opposite way from the boulevard and within 5 mins you're at the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens. The breakfast was a good usual continental breakfast - gives you plenty of carbs to burn off by lunchtime! - and they serve it until mid-day, so plenty of time to lie-in if you've had a late night! We will definately return to Paris to stay in this great hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: victoria131
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in March 2008 for three nights on a weekend break with my mam. We were delighted with our choice of hotel which was in a lovley area of Paris. On our arrival the staff could not have been more helpful and throughout our stay they were very friendly and lovely to talk to. The hotel itself was fantastic, with lovely contemporary decoration and very comfortable beds. The rooms were big enough for us both and our luggage, the bathrooms are compact but we had no problems managing. The location is also excellent and we walked to all of the major sites. There is a great bar/restaurant about 2 minutes walk called Charley Birdy which was also very friendly and had great, reasonably priced food. We would definately recommend the hotel to anyone. Thank you very much for a fantastic stay!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: MoneypennyEngland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a three night stay at the Hotel des Academies et des Arts where we were celebrating our wedding anniversary. We had visited Paris once before and stayed in the 1er arrondissement and, although we enjoyed our first stay, this time we wanted to find a more authentic Parisien neighbourhood to experience a different Paris. Staying at the Hotel des Academies et des Arts we were not disappointed as this is a great hotel in a very appealing area - don't be put off by looking at a map of Paris and wondering if you may be too far off the beaten track as this is not the case at all. The Hotel is located a short and very pleasant 5 minute walk from the Jardin du Luxembourg which is a real hive of activity - recommend lunch in the little cafe there - and you can walk through the Jardin and find yourself near St Sulpice and Boulevard St Germain in no time at all.
