However, the local neighbourhood around Rue Vavin is very buzzy on a Saturday with lots of nice little shops and cafes plus the peaceful Musee Zadkine is just around the corner and you can happily while away a morning or afternoon in the area. There are also several Metro stops near to the hotel for taking trips further afield although you may find yourself, like us, longing to return to the local area when you find yourself emerging from a Metro stop into a typically busy and touristy area!! The Hotel itself is delightful - recently refurbished with a lot of thought and style yet small enough to be really friendly, offering first class personal service. The team on reception were able to recommend some excellent local restaurants, the three that we chose were all no more than a 5 minute walk from the Hotel and we had three superb meals. We decided to pay the extra 15 euros each for breakfast and this was probably one of the nicest hotel breakfast experiences we have had as there is no unseemly battling at a large buffet - instead the hotel staff deliver your own breakfast to your table and, given the current cost of eating out in Paris, we thought that we were getting good value for our 15 euros. Are there any downsides? Well, if your budget allows we would recommend booking into one of the largest rooms as space is at a premium here and our room was a little on the small side. Also try to get a front facing room which will be lighter than those at the back of the hotel. But that's it really - all in all a great find and we will certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, Elegant and staffed by professionals.”
Reviews.Author: Bryno
Reviews.Content: Hotel des Academies et des arts, 15 rue de la Grande Chaumiere. We stayed here for 4 nights in March â€™08 and had a very enjoyable time. It does not surprise me that the hotel is 4th in the Tripadvisor popularity index. First â€“ Location. This lovely hotel is a 10 minute walk from Port Royal Metro and RER station. ( So easily accessible from both Charles de Gaulle and Orly airports). The RER trip from CDG takes about 40 minutes, one way fare is â‚¬8.20, an absolute bargain. The hotel is also served by three other Metro stations, Raspail, Notre Dame des Champs and Vavin. Vavin is only 50 metres away on Boulevard du Montparnasse, while the other two are less than 10 mins easy walk. Check in was dealt with very quickly and efficiently by the lovely Patricia. The hotel is situated right across the road from a well known art school and therefore it is only fitting that the hotel itself has a very arty theme. The theme is based on the â€˜White Figuresâ€™, and you will understand exactly what I mean when you stay here. Very chic, very creative, we loved it. Our room was on the third floor (see my photos). It was compact but perfectly adequate and most comfortable. It was in three sections. Bedroom, bathroom (yes we had a bath, but I'm not sure if all rooms do) and a separate toilet. The room had 4 windows, the most I have ever seen in any hotel bedroom!! The view was of a tiny courtyard at the rear which has also been very creatively attended to with the â€˜White Figureâ€™theme. Our room was beautifully quiet and we enjoyed 4 blissful nights of undisturbed sleep despite being less than 50 metres from the very busy Boulevard du Montparnasse. The bed was one of the most comfortable we had ever slept in and on the last day we tried to find the manufacturers label on the mattress so that we might purchase a similar one for home (how sad is that?) Fresh towels every day and cosmetics etc are provided and the room was expertly cleaned and tidied. Flat screen TV which was nice to switch on for a while in the evening and a hair drier too. There is also a room safe. The lift is very efficient, but how could you not use the amazing spiral staircase with those white figures leading the way !! Free wi fi is available and there is an internet terminal in the elegant reception area. We waited every day to find the Parisien rudeness that many people mention, but we did not find it in Paris and we certainly did not find it at Hotel des Academies et des arts. Our hosts were the epitome of good service and assistance. They booked taxis and restaurants for us and saved us lots of time with excellent directions to metro and sights. I could not fault the service and this alone would bring me back to the hotel again and again. Breakfast is served in the hotel at â‚¬15, but while it looked excellent and we would have liked to have sampled it, there are so many places nearby to try out that we never did eat breakfast there. Favourite nearby patisserie â€˜Au pain de Vavinâ€™ â€“ just 5 minutes away. Favourite nearby restaurant â€“ â€˜Le parc aux Cerfsâ€™ - just 3 minutes away on rue Vavin. An excellent hotel, book it, you wonâ€™t be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “*** Perfect Paris hotel ***”
Reviews.Author: cttwinmom
Reviews.Content: ABSOLUTELY PERFECT!!! My husband and I spent a week at this absolutely wonderful hotel and will most definitely be back. It was our second honeymoon and finding this perfect hotel made the trip one to remember... I chose to reserve here after many, many hours of research on the internet on Paris hotels. I kept reading review after review for Hotel des Academies et des Arts with nothing but glowing references ...now I completely understand why. The room was immaculate, a decent size for French standards, and had a queen size bed (which was a must for us as opposed to 2 twins pushed together). The mattress and pillows were actually more comfortable than our mattress at home. We acutally had a week of the most amazing sleep! (We have 5 year old twins so this meant everything to catch up on sleep!) The bathroom was small but very clean and the shower was always hot and the water pressure was great. Now I know one review said you could hear the water in pipes in another room, an yes on several occasions that was the case, but you have to remember you are in Paris! The buildings are built hundreds of years ago and connecting walls of buildings are shared. In my humble opinion it was not annoying by any means and I am not the most patient person in the world! ;-) The staff was absloutely lovely and they went out of their way to make our stay pleasurable. They assisted us with reservations, recommendations, and directions. We were actually there during the Metro strike and pleasantly suprised to find it really didnt affect anything as we were able to walk to so many things from the hotel. I absolutely can not wait to go back.....my only only worry is that everyone will find out what an incredible place this is to stay in Paris ...and we wont be able to get a reservation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: grazipat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night on our way to Monaco. The hotel is lovely, new and clean. The staff is professional, friendly, helpful and spoke English. Our room was small but well appointed but it was not as small as some hotel rooms we have stayed in. The bed was ultra comfortable and the bath facilities more than adequate. The location was close to metro and bus stations and some very nice cafes and restaurants as well as close to the Luxembourg Garden. This was our first time staying in the 6th, we usually stay on the right bank so this was a change. There were some thoughtful touches throughout the hotel, complimentary use of a computer and interent in the lobby for guests, a lit fire in the fireplace to warm the lobby as well as some interesting decorative touches. The one thing I did not like was that the decorative throw placed across the foot of bed to give a swish of color to the pristine white sheets had a stain on it but since I am a clean freak I probably noticed it when most people might not have. It was just not something I expected. Aside from that one thing everything else was completely spotless. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel but there is a little restaurant in the hotel which served continental breakfast. I am sure it would have been wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: theTraveLees
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - we give it 4.5 stars. The staff was professional and friendly. One guy (Henri) spoke perfect English and was really kind & helpful, but the others spoke not much English at all. Maybe it's because we usually only saw the staff working the desk at night. Henri was very well aware of the hotel's standing on TripAdvisor - they check it very regularly, and really cared about doing a good job and maintaining their popularity on TripAdvisor. Loved the decor of the hotel - beautifully artistic and charming. We had a club double room, and it was tiny (like every other Parisian hotel room) but very well-planned out. Henri told us this hotel even has slightly larger rooms than a normal Parisian hotel, which was pretty laughable, b/c the rooms really were quite small. On the other hand, you could tell a lot of thought went into planning these miniscule rooms, because everything was well-placed, stylish, nice details, quality stuff, etc. The key is to adjust expectations: Remember you're in Paris! Expect to stay in a closet and you'll be nicely surprised by this fabulous and tres chic hotel room. Expect to stay in an American-sized hotel room, and you'll be quite unhappy. 4.5 stars instead of 5 for a couple reasons: 1) The shower temperature was really temperamental & resulted in boiling/freezing/boiling/freezing showers, and we were told that other people had mentioned that to the front desk also. Henri said they had been working on the problem for a while, but were having trouble getting it fixed. 2) While we were sleeping, someone walked in on us without even knocking and left without apologizing - the front desk said it had been someone that was coming around to inspect the rooms. 3) Housekeeping was careless - we almost stepped on a razor that they knocked onto the bathroom floor, and they knocked over our travel-size bottle of conditioner onto the heater next to the shower. When I found it, the bottle & all its insides had melted onto the heater. *sigh* No big deal, really, but still - the next 2 weeks without conditioner were not so fun. But overall, great hotel, great location (safe, close by metro stop, Luxembourg gardens, delicious bakeries - try Pain du Vavin!), a little pricey though not terrible, and we would love to go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in paris!”
Reviews.Author: mckenzieec
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was extremely helpful and friendly. Henry went above and beyond expectations to help make our stay comfortable. The internet on the flat screen tv was a nice touch. Rooms were small but well appointed. Close to the metro for easy access and many great restaurants on the main road. Also close to the very beautiful Luxemburg Gardens. I highly recomend this for any visits to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: frequent6O9traveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel for three nights in early January. Probably I do not need to add positive factors on this hotel since many have already written favorable comments. I of course agree with most of them. Yes, this is a good hotel. What I would like to add, in order to balance the evaluation, is regarding the size. Where we stayed was a standard double room and we had a couple of suitcases with us (since we were from other side of the world). What happened on us is that we were not allowed to find enough room to settle the suitcases due to its smallness. I would stay here again in the light of other positive factors, but I do not recommend this hotel to a sumo wrestler.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly fomred”
Reviews.Author: vbold
Reviews.Content: Hi , We stayed at the hotel des academies et des arts over new years and had a brilliant stay. This is a beautiful small hotel. Yes the rooms are on the small side but this is to be expected in Paris. The rooms are tastefully decorated and the hotel is in a great location. If you are used to staying in a large corporate hotel with 24hr room service and acres of space then this hotel is not for you. If you want a stylish, friendly, small hotel with great service in a great location then this hotel is the best in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Paulo_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply one of the places to stay in Paris! It has been sympathetically refurbished and whilst the rooms are on the small side they are comfortable and have all amenities that anyone could wish for. We stayed in Rm 32, a superior room and we could have asked for no more! The decor is lovely and modern, the beds are comfortable and the power showers are great! The Hotel itself has a very intimate and personal feel and this is enhanced by the friendly and extremely helpful staff that can cater for your stay in Paris! As for location, the hotel is well placed and very near to the Metro station for access to all tourist areas. The area surrounding the hotel is also buzzy and has La Coupole a very famous Frech Brasserie visited by the likes of Hemingway, Piaf and now me! The hotel is also very near St Germain de Pres and that area is worth a visit as is Le Marais - both cool, hip and great areas to walk through and have some food! As for food etc visit La Coupole, Alcazar, Cafe Marly (at the Louvre). As for drinking go to Buddha Bar, the bar at Hotel Costes as well as others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: lizzy217
Reviews.Content: I had originally booked a room at hotel duo, but after reading the reviews on this site, I quickly cancelled and booked here and boy was that the right decision. The team at des academies was amazing, they made sure we knew our way around the city and made any arrangements to restaurants, day trips,etc. The staff is by far better than some 5 star hotels we have stayed at. The rooms ARE small, but very well thought out. We had 3 big suitcases and we made due, there was no wasted space. When in Paris we will go back to des academies.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissKat
Reviews.Content: I have only good things to say about this hotel. My brother & I stayed at the Hotel des Academies for a couple of nights and we found the hotel to be excellent value for money staffed by a team that really went out of their way to make us feel welcome and assist whenever they could. I have stayed in many hotels in Paris that claim a 5 star rating with a price to match and they have been very disappointing. The Hotel des Academies on the other hand does not claim to be anything it is not. It is an excellent 3 and a half star hotel that is tastefully decorated, clean and affordable and the staff were very attentive and welcoming. I will be sure to come back for my next trip to Paris and this little gem of a hotel proves you don't have to spend 400 euros plus a night for a good hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Much Perfect”
Reviews.Author: DrBull
Reviews.Content: This hotel had pretty much everything we needed to have a romantic and comfortable 3 day stay in Paris. Very close to metro and all sightseeing, with great cafes and restaurants nearby (including the famous seafood restaurant - The Dome, just opposite) modern, newly renovated, beautiful room - small (what room in Paris isn't?) but very cosy and beautifully decorated and appointed. Very friendly and helpful staff, great room service, and everything we needed readily available. This hotel was really good value for the price - beyond 3 stars. We would definitely recommend it if you want a trouble-free and comforatble stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: RestlessinIndy
Reviews.Content: Positives: a) excellent location 5 minutes away from Luxembourg Gardens and multiple Metro stations. b) super friendly staff c) excellent (continental) breakfast, d) neat modern art, design and furniture, e) free email access Negatives: a) rooms are small (at least our room 52 was), b) modern design brings with it some quirks like - phone was fastened to night stand so that I had to lie on the floor to dial, - shower temperature hard to fix at the right temperature, - elaborate lighting system takes some time to figure out. Still the positives far outweigh the negatives noted, so we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Cold Outside - Warm Charming Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: gdub2007
Reviews.Content: We just spent three nights at the Hotel des Academies and we had a wonderful stay. We used trip advisor to find this property and the reviews are right on track. The hotel is recently remodeled and very clean. The rooms are small but very nicely decorated and well laid out. Contrary to some of the reviews, our bed was very comfortable and the shower half-door was sealed. It does take some time to adjust the temperature in the shower with the modern handle; but by day three I was an expert. The hotel is centrally located to the bus and subway lines. The Staff (Henri and Patricia) were extremely helpful charting our course every morning and every evening this being our first trip to Paris and having a very long list of things we must do and see. We will be back. Gary & Sherry

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near as good as Tripadvisor would have you believe...”
Reviews.Author: j33per
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the excellent reviews here on tripadvisor and must say that I was very disappointed. The decor is pleasant enough as are the staff and the location was very convenient for me too. However, the size of my club room was very small indeed as was the bathroom which was separated from the room by way of a curtain. If you were to travel on your own, the size wouldn't matter so much, however if you travel with your partner I would suggest you find yourself another place to stay. The hotel has been cleverly designed to pack in as many rooms as possible. In this they have gone way too far. Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service - very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: WorldyEuropean
Reviews.Content: Sorry to be the black sheep on Trip Advisor but our experience and my view of this hotel is very different to the others posted. We used Trip Advisor recommendation to decide for the hotel and therefore I feel compelled to give our experience. So it was my mother's 60th Birthday and my sister and I did lots of research on hotell finally deciding on the Hotel des Academies et des Arts 1) because of location 2) because of so much positive review regarding decor and service. I have stayed at numerous others in St. Germain including the K+K Cayre (which is great) and at first sight, the HDAEDA was a good choice. Decoration is fantastic and staff friendly. However, this shiny exterior soon faded. The rooms are incredibly small - cool decor, well laid out - but minute. I had to leave the bathroom to dry myself after a shower ! We had three rooms in the family, my sis, my mother and myself. all rooms exactly the same except in ours they had squeezed a bath in, making the bathroom even wincier. for this we were charged an extra 35â‚¬ per night because it was deemed a 'superior' room - what a joke. We complained especially as the receptionist agreed that no superior rooms were available (my sis wanted one) and expected them all to be the same price. They were one on top of each other .... since then we have been waiting and debating for a week this extra unreasonable cost. Still not resolved, now waiting for a week. In total we stayed 3 nights - over 1800â‚¬ spent. not by any means a cheap option. My mother was ill on the Saturday so she needed room service. Some kind of hot drink. The hotel info said "up until 11pm" service was available. At 9pm, nothing was possible. Nothing. Not even hot water. We had to go to a local restaurant to get a drink for my ill mother. Not good. Secondly, regarding service - we came back on the Saturday, to no towels in our room. Not even flannels. So we rang down and asked for them. Someone came up and asked to come in the rooms to check there were no towels. I told him there were none and he asked me, "am I sure ?". I also have disbelief at the service but I wouldn't dream of 'accusing my customers of stealing towels'. Same thing happened to us the third night and to my sister and husband. The excuse given when we left was all of the staff are new, nothing by way of apology. Thirdly, breakfast was very average. Nothing special compared with the K+K buffet which had champagne and a big fruit selection. HDAEDA's was served as there is no space for a buffet. My final gripe was that the TV system was rubbish. Nice flat panel TV, but the menus were very slow, very poor selection of TV channels and for almost everything, you had to pay extra. In summary, I don't want to be unfair. We enjoyed our stay enough, staff were friendly and decor was cool. However, service was lame and the value - per sq metre of hotel you get (i.e. cost and room size) was extremely low in our view. I just don't think this is the best hotel in Paris and I find it hard to believe all of the previous reviewers had none of the issues we experienced. p.s. the candid photos shown must have been Suites I think, not very representative. We had two normal and one superior / club room, all minute.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: goddessnancy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice in two months and it is spectacular. Very cool boutique hotel with ultra friendly staff - feels like being at home in Paris. The decor is tasteful, the rooms comfortable - especially by Parisian standards. I cannot say enough about the friendliness of the staff - it is truly the personal service that sets this hotel apart from the rest. This hotel is becoming very popular so book ahead of time - a great homebase in Montparnasse!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Hev27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights at the end of November but would have loved to stay longer. Not only is it in a convenient and easy to find location (2 minutes away from Vavin metro station), but it is beautifully decorated and welcoming. From the moment we arrived, the staff and owners (who all spoke perfect English) were falling over themselves to help us, recommending nearby restaurants/cafes, the best transportation, places to visit, and telling us about the history of the hotel. With original art in every room and a great living room full of books on the subject, this is a great place for an art lover to stay, but everyone will appreciate its classy decor and overall warmth. Rooms are typically small (but not overly so) and it is somewhat expensive, but totally worth it. I could not think more highly of this place and will definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: cherylakam
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at this charming little hotel...although rooms are small, there is a place for everything (even 2 large suitcases). The staff is friendly and accomodating, eager to help in any way and, in case it matters, their English is very good too. Breakfasts are expensive (15 Euros per person) but nicely served and of course, very convenient. There are some great restaurants very close by and the area feels safe for walking to and from them at night. All in all, we felt we had made a great choice for our stay of 8 nights.
